QnLtmQUZkVdW4mA1MO-E_Q.text: Just got takeout from Kobe on Elliot. this is some of the worst Asian we've ever had. called the restaurant to let them know and was told that there was no manager on duty and they didn't know what time they were going to come in (soon) and they didn't know which manager it will be. will probably not go back because it was worse than Panda Express. The chicken was dry and crusty in the teriyaki chicken  and udon noodles as though it had been cooked and left to sit for hours. The sauces were lacking flavor. The other times we've been there have been good. This time AWFUL! What happened? (Check 24 on 10/14/16)

VR9FGHyOgAYgEXkPx2JDdw.text: Went for our 9th anniversary dinner. My date and I both ordered the Kobe steak and shrimp. The meal was fantastic. I have been to Japan and had real Wagyu and I can say that this is a fairly close American substitute. The atmosphere was great. Waitress was prompt and courteous. Cook was fun and entertaining with tabletop tricks. Would definitely go back. Great date place.

U6tFW8MX2IArNjgbREFjeQ.text: Worst restaurant experience I've ever had. We waited about 10 minutes for a waitress to even come to our table and it was only because we called her over. Ordered some drinks and put in an order for 4 sushi rolls. My water had a giant piece of cabbage or something in it so I had to send it back. We then proceeded to wait for over an hour for our sushi. Decided it wasn't even worth the wait so we paid for our drinks and left extremely hungry. Went down the street to Sakana sushi and was in and out in less time than we spent at kobe. The service was a hundred times better and the food was delicious!  I will NEVER go back to Kobe. I can't believe this place is even still in business.

FK0GJZWiF3Sgy5B4yNsxZw.text: Kobe Bryant Sucks By The Rue  Enjoyed some happy hour, At Kobe Japanese Steakhouse, They don't have sweet and sour, And I don't have a spouse.  A great happy hour selection, On their food and drink, Just some minor imperfections, I'd eat here with Barton Fink.  Kobe Bryant does it in the kaboose, Even if you try to deny him, He'll make your rear end loose, But I hear he prefers them slim.  $4 sushi rolls and $4 beers, This place has got it gonig on, Great for cows and for steers, They also pour their drinks strong.   Their menu has such a variety, Go alone or with a group, This place won't give you anxiety, But it might make you go poop.  DENVER!!!

GxfLlcDsGv0yXJlLmgPnMA.text: Cool place for teppanyaki & sushi. Went during lunch on Saturday. Not too busy. Service was bit lacking, hence 3 stars, granted there was only 1 waitress in the teppanyaki section. Sushi selection was decent & reasonably priced. Teppanyaki cook was entertaining & did well cooking the meal. Exhaust fan might need to be clean, took a bit longer for the smoke to clear area. Overall pleased & will return again.

zctrleTSGMog7Vbk0gfLFw.text: Went there for a child's birthday. Everyone had a great time and the food was really good. Service was great. Will come back.

7LTxFWqHQA5w7MHLA-dMtg.text: Had an awesome experience here! Satisfied in every way. Sushi was so tasty! I had the chicken and the spicy tuna roll.

CA0Siiin5g1Exjc83odWPQ.text: Great meats. Okay chicken fried rice. Not so good salad dressing. Overall atmosphere 4 stars.  I'll be back for the best stake of my life.

oMgfkvBpYdSwkJx3eyKJXw.text: Came here with a party of 5 for a birthday. In general the food was very good. Although we did not order Sushi, the Teppenyaki was delicious. Our chef was very nice, the show was also very good. The price was rather high. Our bill was $70 for two Teppenyaki dinners, 3 beers.

5et9IrXK6eksQ2t1ZjX9gA.text: My family of four came here on a Thursday night and we had a great time at the teppan table! Not cheap, but I thought it was a good amount of food and quality for the price. The table show was awesome. My only complaint was that the wait staff was slow to refill beverages and bring the bill.

bY7bSj9rl9VywAT_bID1FQ.text: The place only good for mingle. The food taste better for dine in. Take out food are SUCK! And the service super slow. But maybe people come here just because this is the only Teppan on the area.

PSqhIqI3xznJFWGwk6S1hA.text: Kobe (Koe-Bay).  We haven't been to one of these places for a teppan performance/meal in quite awhile.  We last went to one about 3 years ago in Boston.  Prior to that was about 5 years ago in Denver.  Before that was Cleveland about 9 years ago.  Based on that, look for another teppan review late in 2012 from either Chicago or Seattle - I haven't decided yet but the fares are good that far out.  Our chef Gabriel did a nice job on both the food and the performance.  There was plenty of throwing things in the air, spinning various implements around, flashes of fire, smoldering onion volcano's and tidbits tossed to the folks around the table who tried mostly successfully to catch as well as our dog.  Gabriel also rewarded folks with a nice shot of sake from his squirt bottle.  I actually had enough of these to have a nice sake buzz going.  That's right - I catch food like a dog better than the other folks at the table.  A fact I'm not sure I should be proud of.  I ordered the filet & shrimp.  It came with miso soup which was fair and lacking very much tofu, a small and plain salad with a pretty mild ginger dressing, grilled shrimp appetizer and white rice.  This is the only teppan meal I have had that does not include fried rice - it is a couple bucks extra.  I opted for the fried rice which was pretty good.  The shrimp (both the appetizer and those that came with the main course) were tender and tasty.  The filet was not as tender but still tasty.  Overall, not a bad deal for the meal & show.  I frankly have grown a bit weary of these but it is fun to go with kids or teppan virgins.

vnXjuB_0A75iZAGhzq2bIA.text: I went here for my birthday last night. In all my dining out experience, I have never had so much fun at a Japanese Steak House! The food was excellent, the service quick and order accurate, and even though we had a full table and it felt a little squished, the family we were seated next to was welcoming and sweet. (Though this is always hit or miss, as you can't control who you're seated next to).   I had the Filet Mignon and Chicken combo which came with the soup, salad and chicken fried rice. We had a crab wonton app, and then they brought me some chocolate ice cream with a candle in it and sang me a birthday song, complete with a drum and everything! Also, the chef threw bits of meat into our mouths from afar and we tried to catch them, and squirted sake into our mouths with a squeeze bottle: mine until it overflowed. My bf laughed at me.  Definitely going back here. Would be curious to try their sushi as well since we opted for the grill last night. They didn't have TV in our section but might in the others(?) so chose "not sure" on that. No big as there's so much going on that I wouldn't have been watching TV.   All in all, it was an excellent experience. I highly recommend this restaurant.

PVAqLF-JeSqDHHlBAG2Jcw.text: So far.. first time here and the hostess girls are the rudest and most unprofessional girls I've ever witnessed. PLEASE GET NEW STAFF UP FRONT

OuI7Vb0hJVKjzhMVfIH_Ww.text: Late night option with me and a date turned into a great experience thanks to Connor McLeod (there can be only one.) The teriyaki chicken and steak was cooked perfectly as well was the rice and vegetables. We will definitely be back for more, thanks for the great experience Connor.

JZZatiuOgILLNOfYeiw12w.text: We ordered 4 sushi roles at 545pm. At 6:22 our food still wasn't ready and our server stopped by to let us know the kitchen was behind. At 6:35 we left; the server had not been by, no mgr either and no food. We let the host know we were leaving. This was  on a Wed night and it was not busy.

7VCs4E6tRpcph8k7CsnMWg.text: Came here 2 Saturdays ago to use a gift certificate the boss man gave me for Christmas.  They have happy hour 7 days a week as long as you're not in the teppan dining room (which we were not).  I ordered a Tokyo Iced Tea, which the server explained was like a Long Island but with Midori. I do not recommend the Tokyo Iced tea. I do not recall all the rolls that we ordered. Everything was pretty much up to par with what I expect from a reasonably priced Sushi restaurant! Really fresh food, really good prices!

OVBit9zeQRwltQa-NHCGWg.text: We had Conner last night as our chef and he made the experience a solid 10. I highly recommend this place and him as a chef if you're looking to have a good time.

D3s1MZaUFn-v9pWYvpV9_A.text: It's the best you can find. Good food. Taste great. Make you feel like you're on a different country.

gr2-gIBaokgSrmdriDIoUQ.text: Came in at 7ish to have dinner and was advised to come back at 8pm and they would be ready so we did and we sat at our table for an hour !!!! Before having any cook come to us.... As I sit here writing this review I brought new people to try and they will not be back.  Worst service I have had here ever !  And I was here to celebrate my 30th

fs4w96VZU7bCW45gJtCTKQ.text: As always, the food at Kobe is excellent. As always, the service is the worst. We ordered sushi appetizers. Mine came out immediately. My husband's came out 20 minutes later, right after the salad. We then got the soup (same time as the salad - I hate that) and the entree was prepared soon after.  Thankfully we went in early because of show tickets. So we had time before the entree was prepared. Usually, we get all the food at once and often out of order.  Kobe - you need to invest in training your staff about timing.

photos.caption: Photo of Kobe Teppan & Sushi - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cool fish tank.

RsnxFQE2Ull4K5XPPXI0gA.text: Went there for lunch.  Wasn't told there was a all you can eat menu.  After ordering a couple rolls some others came in and asked for the all you can eat menu.  Asked why I wasn't told about all you can eat menu but all she said was sorry.  Over charged me for one of my rolls and charged $1.75 for one cup of tea (not a pot).  I would say not a very ethical place.

qRBzbBcKloviGlFgEXk4AQ.text: Just a bad experience because a guy at our table was a tool and super rude to the Chef and that kinda ruined everyone's time because the chef was clearly over it

dIVggerv-GiVhU1-uK83gw.text: Overall the food and service is pretty good here. They dont skimp on the quantity. Do not waste your money on what they are claiming to be their Kobe beef. I'm guessing they havent been to Japan. The so called kobe is just prime steak, but not even 10% marbeling that a True kobe is.

AteOwvE_p6OtrCD88ISN7A.text: The food is definitely good and tasty, place is clean, prices are reasonable and workers are courteous. BUT - and this was a real turn-off - the service was sooooooo slow. Our family of 4 came on a Monday evening, arriving about 7:20. We chose to do a regular table rather than the teppan table (which had a 20 minute wait - we overheard the hostess telling the couple in front of us). That didn't factor into our decision to get a regular table though. We ordered Kobe Tofu and shrimp tempura as appetizers, the kids wanted Tempura Udon soup, I ordered the soft shell crab dinner, and my husband and the kids ordered salmon sashimi, Sunshine roll, Ikura, tamago, tako and yellowtail sushi. The appetizers came out within 10 minutes - hey, off to a good start! Then the soft shell crab, then one tempura udon soup, and that's it....two tables became occupied while we were waiting for the rest of the order. The table ahead of us, with 2 people, ordered a small fried rice and a chicken teriyaki- the rice order came out after 10 minutes, then after another 10-15 minutes, the teriyaki order came out. These 2 people had finished their meal and paid and are now getting up to leave, and we still haven't gotten the rest of our order. The table behind us, with 5 people, have ordered and their appetizers are out. I am now finished with my soft shell crab dinner and my daughter is finished with her soup. A lady comes to clear my dishes and I ask where's the rest of the order - her response, "sorry, sorry - kitchen is busy..." very polite, yes, but it is now over an hour - I don't run a restaurant or anything but I don't understand how the kitchen can bring out half of the order and not the rest at an appropriate interval. It's sad really because the food was tasty but I don't think I'm coming back nor am I really going to recommend this place to anyone else, unless they have a good 3 hours to wait for all the order to come out.

66ZgEl-Ed4kwGNNiKwViSA.text: Prices are decent for happy hour but the menu is small. Service is just ok. I only go once in a while for a quick bite. The tempura mushrooms are delicious though!!

photos.caption: Photo of Kobe Teppan & Sushi - Tempe, AZ, United States

_ZAAIn4edRAngdxuGL9rKw.text: Normally have entertaining servers.  Tonight we brought a special guest from Germany to celebrate his birthday.  Couldn't have been more disappointed in our service.  Our chef didn't utter one word. Did nothing to enhance the presentation. Never offered Sake.  They would have forgot his birthday if I had not gone out to remind the hostess after our bill had been delivered to the table.  Total disappointment.

AOsKzXzZm7zoXnHxX5v77A.text: Nice! The husband and I came here thanks to Yelp one night when we were craving sushi and saki. Sure hit the spot! Our server, I forgot his name but a younger tall kid took care of us. He was very attentive and I was impressed with the level of service and how sweet he was. I got a Kirin light and Sake and the husband got some pink drink, the drink was strong though! The sushi was very good and fresh tasting. We are planning to stop by on their happy hour, the prices are very good and we can get a delish meal and drink for 30 bucks! Yum!

_MSg0xyMVpZZSF2ZWwA9Qg.text: I like Kobe the sushi is excellent and the  teppanyaki is something you need to experience. I mostly have gone for sushi and o think the sushi is the best thing on the menu, I especially like the Ikura and salmon skin hand rolls. Next is the teppanyaki it is good and a show is always enjoyable but not my favorite thing. I've had the lunch specials and not too impressed so I take it down a star. If you ask if I would recommend this place, yes, yes I would.

DQS-dEyLq_D1VXEQ5Hm9BA.text: I have always loved my teppanyaki experiences here, but what really "WOWed" me was when I came in for dining on my own. I sat in the bar area, and Gail was ABSOLUTELY incredible. Not only was she delivering amazing customer service to me and assisting me with what I was needing, she also was great with her other customers (it was a slow day so I got to overhear).  I am so happy I got to experience the food and customer service, delivered by Gail and her Kobe team, that inspired me to write this review!

dHu-WK-KIln9HgQq-dcXQQ.text: I like to go here for the Teppanyaki, they do a good job with chicken, steaks, and seafood on the grill.  The chicken fried rice is amazing!  They have a great selection of drinks from the bar, and the customer service is pretty good.  For example, I wanted two miso soups instead of getting a salad, and they let me make that swap without a problem.  The portion size is generous, I always have some to take home.  I'm looking forward to the next time I can come here for Teppanyaki with friends!

vlJOZnZkaMLbLP31nqZjoA.text: Every time I come to dinner here, I'm more and more impressed. The food is always delicious and the teppan is an experience worth the money. My favorite chef is Taylor, he's so funny and very considerate of everyone's order (will ask for clarification and makes sure your order is perfect).  The Kobe steak is to die for (make sure to order it rare or medium rare) and everything is always fresh. Luke is the best server, try to get his table of you can. He's very polite, friendly and knowledgeable. James is also great, but I have had Luke a couple of times and he's always the best!  Never left with a complaint and always full. Much better than chains like Benihana!!

HcSyOib_Osz6L0oUHZllXw.text: I've only been here about eight times when I am working from our Tempe office and can say it is in my top three.  I usually get the lunch special at the sushi bar for under ten bucks that comes with:  - Miso Soup  (really simple but good) - Green Salad (Amazing! The salad dressing makes this work) - California Roll  - Spicy Tuna Roll - Wasabi and Ginger  When you get there you are stalled by the "wait to be seated" sign that is as obvious as the stop sign on school buses when picking up the kids, the only problem is they are not very prompt at seating or for that matter someone being in the front to greet and seat.  So I just head to the sushi bar.  The prepares at the sushi bar are all on their game, they immediately offer you a sushi menu with the understanding of order when ready.  My four stars are based on the food and service they provide because if it went with the staff that seats, brings menus, takes orders and delivers food, the four would easily be a three, maybe even two.  I avoid bringing groups because of the service not the food and can say I have tried more than just the lunch menu and the food is terrific, the quality of service does not match but I still give this place four stars because it is worth trying.

6oawPlBJecDyStvt6-aDpw.text: It was ok they up charged 9 dollars on a 6 dollar roll to omit rice and do a cucumber wrap. I fee that's a total rip. 2-4 dollars but 15 for a plain roll I won't be going back. The Vegas roll was super small and the scallop roll was dry. I don't recommend but proceed with caution. If you like spending 50 dollars for 4 rolls that are subpar then by all means please this place may be for you!

DRPF-i4Fys4h2xDpSB3IaA.text: Benihana who!?  If you're looking for a fun time & you're with a large group this is the perfect outing! I've been here twice with large groups & have had a great, enjoyable, experience both times!  Starting with food, this is your standard teppanyaki place. They have a good sized menu, including sushi, but the teppanyaki really makes the experience.  Their teppan chefs are always super friendly, funny, & creative.. & the thing that sets this place apart from others I've been-- they will squirt straight sake shots into your mouth.  Portions are good, service is fast, & all the staff is very welcoming. I will continue to recommend Kobes over any teppan place in the valley!

iCa8OzgLpIQtrcwOfwUh9g.text: Dead bug on glass. Stuck on the side of it. Server took so long to come by our table I called their phone number asking for someone to take our order. Over 25 minutes to place an order. We ordered 5 rolls. Only 4 came. When i told server we are missing a dragon roll she told us we only ordered 3 rolls, even though 4 were sitting in front of us. Thanks for the free roll but we wont be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Kobe Teppan & Sushi - Tempe, AZ, United States. Dead bug on glass. Looks like a tick. Disgusting. Only took 10 minutes to flag down server to get a new glass.

n6Gp5iofkkGGYNGP5YCIDQ.text: Get place for lunch ! Free miso, and the sushi is served large and is always continues to be good.

idOBm0ShrRUvrK8adz6b4A.text: I have been going to this restaurant for kids birthdays for probably 8 years. Last night I took my family, 7 people for teppan. I will not be going back.   We arrived 15 min early for our reservation. Went to the bar, we were unable to even get a glass of water in the bar as there was no bartender and none of the servers would serve us  We went to the table and then say there with no server for 20 minutes.  I finally complained to the hostess a server came by. Took a drink order and then came back and told us that he could make the drinks  We left 40 minutes in without even a drink. 6 or 7 other customers walked out too  I emailed the manager last night as well and never got a response  I took my kids to red robin for their birthday instead.

HHzLHb2aDrvw75YbSszIuw.text: Another Lunch Review, at least I tried to Lunch here.  I was in the mood for sushi and Kobe is right across the street from my office so I figured I could walk and get to go in my 30 min lunch break   Sushi for lunch and I don't have to get in my hot car?  Score!  Here's where things fail.  They don't open for lunch until 11:30, I arrived at 11.  Who doesn't open for lunch until 11:30?!  Especially with multiple business complexes in the area (think Insight, Honeywell, U of Phoenix, Express Scripts) and hungry workers.  Walked back to my car and went to Sakana down the street which is what I should have done in the first place.

hJm4RGPTcOmRZjTbpB6PoA.text: This place was so good. My bf said it was comparable to Benihana (which I've never been to). We did the teppanyaki. I had chicken and shrimp and my boyfriend had the seafood delight.   Drinks- a large beer was only $6.75. However, the happy hour prices are around the whole restaurant MINUS the teppanyaki.   Food- miso was good. Salad was okay. I prefer thicker peanut dressing. The main course was amazing! A lot of flavor. One negative was they gave you ginger sauce and mustard but no shrimp sauce.   Service- the chef was so funny. He squirted saki in my bfs mouth twice. I appreciated how he checked in to see if anyone was a vegetarian. The show was great. We did Not have a lot of interaction with the waitress.   Would recommend to anyone wanting to try teppanyaki.

uZQoNF-CZMPkYbPDFAansA.text: The steak and shrimp combo is so yum o! Its one of the few teppanyaki grills left here in the east valley. Their sushi is really good too. I usually order the rainbow roll, not to big on sweet sauce or cream cheese in sushi. The lobster is and kobe steak is awesome! The prices are not bad considering the amount of food you get and the sake being sprayed at you... very entertaining. The kobe I believe is american kobe... its way too inexpensive to be japanese kobe. All in all one of my fav places. They have great lunch specials also!

a41WElB_KqvlxA3DmhmihA.text: We eat here all the time and normally the experience is good, but last night we actually walked out due to poor service. The place was busy but we sat in the back room which was not full. A 12-top was seated right next to us before we were seated. We had our 17-month old with us and had to get our own high chair. We waited twenty minutes with not a single word or even eye contact from the waitress, who walked right by us several times to other tables. She took the drink order from the big table, then went to the table behind us, apologized for the delay and took their order. I expected her to take ours at the same time, but nope, she went to put their order in. She then went to another table and refilled the guy's water glass. She came back with the drinks for the big table. I thought she might be bringing water to us, but she then proceeded to take the order from the 12-top first (which is never a fast task - they were asking about the specials on the board in the front lobby, so she had to run out to check what they were). They also had to remind her that not all drinks had been served for their table yet. All this time, still no eye contact, hello, sorry for the wait, I'll be right with you, anything to placate us. My husband even went out to the car to get snacks for our daughter, which I ended up eating. Finally we gave up and left. We did say something to front hostess and got a weak "sorry". If I ran my business like this, I'd be out of business! Not sure when we'll be back.

oL_khU5oFKMHE4Zvo8IrDA.text: I had never been here before and was really looking forward to eating here with my wife and daughter. We were part of a 16 top table of friends seated at one of the Teppanyaki tables. Now, those who know me say I'm a patient guy, but this place really tried my patience. They did not disperse enough menus for the whole table and my wife, her friend and I sat her for FIFTEEN FRIGGIN' MINUTES waiting just for a menu. Finally I personally got up and walked to the host station and grabbed the menus myself. BTW we still haven't placed a drink order yet. That happened about ten minutes later as I looked at my watch and noted it was just shy of a  1/2 hour before we even placed our drink order. With that said, my Saki Bomber wasn't delivered for another 20 minutes. In short it was just shy of an hour to get drinks and order! Are you friggin' kidding me!?!!?!! My wife ordered iced tea and they brought no sugar - another 10 minutes watching the ice melt. If not part of a large party I most definitely would have got up and walked.   On that note, one of the gals saw my displeasure of the near hour long drink order and delivery method and said to me, "Yea, the service really sucks here, you're kinda at their mercy as to what they want to do...but I love the Tepp Chef." Eeeek, boy, wrong kinda love I thought.    Anyhow, the prices are a bit up there but you get a lot for it. They all include a cup of Miso soup, a small salad, a shrimp appetizer, rice, hibachi vegetables and your main course cooked in front of you. Now to be fair, the abysmal non-existent service from the beginning did pick up almost to pace. I was even asked for a new beer before the other was finished = which shocked me. The food courses were rolled out timely.   Miso soup was good but not great. It was very hot and flavorful but the tofu cubes were smaller then an eraser head. The salad had if I recall correctly, a ginger vinaigrette and was small but decent with a single tear drop tomato in it. You also got a shrimp appetizer which was cooked by the Tepp Chef on the flat top. The shrimp was very good. What I liked about these courses is that my wife doesn't like miso soup OR shrimp so I got both of hers - shoot...swish.   I ordered the scallops for my dinner with double hibachi veg and no rice. I was pleased that there was an abundance of scallops and they were seasoned and cooked perfectly. My wife ordered the chicken and it was absolutely terrible- dry and tasteless.   Now the real value at this place and my only guess as to why ANYONE would venture to dine here are the Tepp Chefs. They are extremely entertaining. I got a real kick out of the Japanese chef speaking Slang Spanglish and the comedic value of this seemingly flying over most peoples head. This guy was really funny cool man. He did the whole onion volcano bit which is always entertaining. He made me slap the backs of my hands together like a friggin' circus seal and beg for a shrimp bite which he tossed up at me in the air to catch with my mouth, and when I did he squirted, from one of those squeezy type ketchup or mustard plastic bottles, sake into my mouth as a reward. That sake squirting gag was a gas man as he squirted it into the mouth of a woman at the table but kept doing it for like 7 seconds as it all dripped out of her mouth and onto her chest and shirt - funny stuff.

iQYenIKjaRAkMxjofp50YQ.text: I love love love this place.  I usually come here with a group of friends and we do the "Teppan Style".   I love this place more than any other teppanyaki place.  My food is always good and I have always had a reallly good cook with a great performance. I can't wait to go again. :) Yummy!  The only thing I have a problem with is when we go there with big groups the waitresses tend to take your order and then disappear. They are nice but sometimes hard to get back. I like to always have a drink available and I like it when they check on me. I guess it's hit and miss.

Nr9_sESpTmgmCxVwt5NGtQ.text: Benihana style restaurant with good Sushi and Tepan cooking.  You'll get the usual fare:  terriyaki, tempura, and sushi, but the food is well prepared and the presentation was very good.  Not an inexpensive place, however.

H1tPm-yZTB0oK0Bu13e2aw.text: We went to Kobe Japanese Steak House to celebrate our daughter's second birthday a few weeks ago. We were seated at a table with another family, who also happened to be celebrating their child's second birthday. First off, I must say that this is a great restaurant for children. The servers are accommodating and the teppan chef is mindful of the children and interactive with them. Taylor was our chef and he was so friendly and fun. Definitely request him if he's working. We requested extra tofu for our daughter, not once, but twice, and they were happy to meet our requests. The food was delicious and plentiful, and none of us left hungry. We had such a great time that we came back two weeks later with my in-laws and the only difference was that Taylor wasn't working that night. The food was still delicious and we definitely look forward to returning another time. If you are bringing a toddler, you might want to use a towel or blanket to have them sitting higher in the high chair so they get a better view of all the teppan chef is doing..

CaTxn0OtPU7nXvxbkDdHpA.text: Warning do not go here!!! 18 friends of mine went here last Friday night for a Xmas party. We were told when we made our reservations for 18 that if we were not all here at 10 min. After our time the reservation would be cancelled. We all showed up on time and our table was not ready and the place was empty. After we were finally seated we spent some time opening gifts (maybe 15 min) and we were told by our server to hurry up! She said the chef was waiting. We all ordered and ate. The food was ok at best. The service was HORRIBLE! We had to beg for drinks and told we couldn't get saki because they didn't have any clean glasses. Our big came out to $1,000 and it was the worse! I called to complain today and the manager simply replied he was sorry. I work as a public relation manager at our office so I just wanted to give Kobe a chance to make good on our horrible meal but not one solution came out of his mouth! Take your money and run!!!!

ih1PblXCpr2LBvGwHcHzxw.text: Came here for lunch with coworkers... it was very busy so I though this might be a good place for sushi after all.  Unfortunately I was wrong.  I ordered the Tuna Tataki salad and a side of chicken fried rice.  The flavor of the dressing of the salad was very good and what I am used to tasting.  My problem is with the tuna that was in the salad they were rather large pieces so you had to bite into them... you pretty much had to wrestle with it.  Just not the quality of fish I am used to eating.   The chicken fried rice I had was awesome, I think it might be one of the best I have tasted.  Others I were dining with had the veggie tempura plate which I did try and was very good.  Fried sweet potatoes, carrots zucchini, etc.  Others had the sushi rolls and their thoughts on the fish were about the same as mine.  I would go back, just not for sushi.

_pxIEAy_db65B_5BWiztdw.text: Wow! I am shocked at the reviews. I think this place is awesome to eat.... Their prices can be expensive if u go after lunch. Always had a great experience every time.

fVfjjeW10tr9_nsfkMqKmg.text: It was OK... the sushi wasn't that fresh.  I liked the inside... we ate in the sushi area.  The other side looked like Benihana.  Nothing terrible.

wJkQ81izA9xETcult7BWKQ.text: This place is AMAZING! I don't even know how to describe how much you need to go to this place. They have a great wide variety of cultured food. It's great and they have Tofu and Veggie plates if your Vegan or Vegitarian. It's so amazing.  The two best things are the Crunchy California Rolls and the fried rice. You dont even understand how amazing they are. They are just so perfect and to be able to watch them cook right in front of you is just perfect. We've never had bad service. :) They are wonderful! Keep it up Kobe!

pBJsKb5I_EBoe-oqDRyqcw.text: Love love love Kobe! They have great happy hour specials and wonderful service! My husband and I go to Kobe at least twice a month. They have the BEST chicken fried rice and miso soup! It is a very relaxed place and caters to everyone from families to couples on dates. We will be regulars for a very long time to come.

VepHLntHJ-6BCmHf97aAOg.text: Went here for happy hour and it was neat and cheap.  Sat at a table in the bar area, nice atmosphere.  Ordered the spicy tuna roll which was nothing to brag about but it was 3.25.  The Vegas Roll and Shrimp appetizer were very good.  Entire bill was 24 bucks with two saki bombers.  Awesome deal and quality tasty food.

L92JGkl20r3mX45u4bQCzA.text: It used to be a good restaurant! But It is noe one very mediocre one! on;t go there.. they make you wait a long time .... in the top of that they don't cook their food very good too.. Too expensive, to poor quality.

YEWPwF-uXw98dwoxj8udbg.text: I kind of liked Kobe. The teppanyaki has always been great. The sushi is often hit or miss. I used to be a somewhat regular there, living through the meh sushi to get the good. What stopped me going there completely, besides discovering Sushi Eye not even a mile away, was an event that happened one Saturday. My husband and I were sitting at the bar like we always did when an off-duty waitress showed up with a puppy she had just purchased. Not only did she take the dog to the sushi bar, but stood right next to us at the end of the bar so the sushi chefs could pet her new pooch. The manager joined in on the doggy loving and then took her and the dog to the back, towards the kitchen. Granted, there was probably an office back there, but do you really want a dog in the kitchen where your food is being prepared? Granted, this happened at least a year or two ago, and I called the county health department, but I haven't been back since.

pXjEdLDT6ENi9W5NihCTrw.text: i love the place way better than benihanas and ichiban...there sushi is so so but i go for the swordfish... it does suck that you get seated with other people but once they get the saki out people start to wind down abit and mingle...love the ichiban beer...all in all i love there food fun place to go

9tJR_LYfV4IGaJKG3NtncQ.text: great food, great happy hour, fun and entertaining teppan chefs, sushi is standard, awesome salt water tank in front.

uD4hEqb0tcQtQSSSJxCchA.text: Love this place. Great atmosphere. Good selection of foods. Helpful staff. Great time for all ages. Plenty of food portion and the fish tank is cool too!

PDSPbjfwMai4JUQUivv3hQ.text: Went here for my graduation dinner it was nice because I had a lot of people and this restaurant accommodated the amount of people I had.. the drinks are good and the food is great!! I'll be back again

g_kIvCTB4P6D-ttlFDtrgQ.text: Was fast, clean, fresh, so Much fun!! I had the Kobe.... Cheeeeeez!! Haven't had such a great piece of Kobe in years. Careful! They warn you they might run out of it. Call in advance and check for availability. At 44 bucks per person, you will not regret for a second, really nice piece of meat-heaven playing a symphony in your mouth!!!

0cFNfa6HIrXVNdN9fjKFQw.text: Always have had a great experience here! The sushi side is the way to go, good price for great sushi. Appetizers are great, and the service is the best! We usually have the same waitress and she is always very good. Efficient, and friendly! If you're in the mood for an after-work sushi run definitely try this place!

ujOGcdcfuyYhULKLeGJefw.text: My first time at Kobe was a fun experience. Went with a group of friends to celebrate a birthday. We had a reservation, but we arrived early and had a drink at the bar. Once we were seated, we did have to wait awhile (about 10 minutes) before someone came to get our order. After the drinks arrived, we waited another 10 minutes or so for the action to start. Our chef was Andrew and he was great!! He made the experience fun and we enjoyed watching his skills. The entrees werr great, some had the filet, others shrimp and chicken. I got to try a bit of everything and the swordfish was amazing! Overall, a really fun place to share some great food and drinks with friends.

Lh-td8kleW3qZagYeCI_3w.text: Kobe's become one of our favorite sushi hang outs in Ahwatukee. Happy hour specials are really good and six dollar sake bombers are the bomb.   We have a spot we always sit in at the sushi bar and we always have the same couple of waitresses. They are knowledgeable, fast and very courteous.   They have a Teppan-Yaki area that we have never gone to yet but appears to be very popular!  Have a great birthday song.  If you're looking for a local happy hour that's good definitely hit up Kobe.

eFEu3OPV8RQyNnC35i7dew.text: I went here with my girlfriends for dinner and the the food was delicious. The chicken fried rice was my favorite! I would definitely recommend the jalapeno poppers. Chef Aleen was amazing he was entertaining to watch and made us all laugh throughout our dinner. I think everyone should give this place a chance.

p__cKjqs37iVv-VGmgF56g.text: Holy wow!  This has got to be one of the worst places to come if you are hungry or on any type of schedule.  45 mins after being seated at an empty grill, I have water.  Took them 30 mins to even ask what I wanted to drink.     1 hour into this, I have now placed my order but we are still without our chef.  The plus side is that I now have my salad and all of a sudden my soup showed up too.    90 mins after being seated I finally have my dinner!   Service itself needs a lot of help. The chef was fun and the food very tasty.   Not sure id come back if I have anything else planned after dinner but would probably come back to try the happy hour specials

zRx_tchZp8YvDNF8KOjl8g.text: Where so I start.... not out first time at Kobe. We go quite often because our kids love it. So Valentine's Day we decided to go to Kobe and did regular dining (that was not busy like teppen). Here is what we ordered... Teriyaki Combo (beef and chicken), mix tempera, 2:2 piece sake salmon, soft shell crab sushi and the Big Red Special. First we were brought not mixed tempura but shrimp tempura and I asked if that was the mixed she said yes. She brings a side of rice for the teriyaki combo but no combo, 20 min later the combo arrives no salad or miso that comes with the dinner. So now there is cold rice which she does switch out. What was the point because the teriyaki combo was cold. A different person proceeds to bring us 2 plates of salmon not what we ordered and some kind of imitation crab thing. Not ours so we wait for the rest of the sushi. In the mean time we are brought someone else's dishes 3 different times. At this point I was over it. We asked for the check and we left hungry going to McDonald's. I think this will probably be the last time at Kobe. Never have we ever experienced this type of service and for it to be a bad experience on a special holiday.

wjxlU7zEhejPCv-SEkbPcw.text: I love it and I love Benihanas il be honest had more flavor and gave yu more food on plate

photos.caption: Photo of Kobe Teppan & Sushi - Tempe, AZ, United States. One of my favorites

fW-GAhhu_LJnchOw4-zZuw.text: Although there seem to be quite a crowd, and a lot of people eating sushi, I saw very few eating steak. My guest had sushi and I ordered the steak medium rare. Both of our meals were above average in quality and presentation. Our only complaint would be in the cleanliness on the outside as well as the inside. The outside dining had a lot to be changed as far as Quality dining. The outside had a lot of trash and cigarette butts all over the ground. The inside was not very clean as far as the window seals and the tables. When we went to sit down our table had sauce and other leftover food along the edges and underneath.

photos.caption: Photo of Kobe Teppan & Sushi - Tempe, AZ, United States. Kobe&#39;s on W. Elliot Rd. in Tempe Arizona. Well known for their Sushi and steaks.

2u-IMs17DPbb9OOk_DvxyA.text: This is my sushi spot ! I love Kobe ! The San Diego roll is so yummy ! I live about a mile away but if I didn't I would make the drive ! Pics to come !

qOyzU1_FMeS2C1sNgTt9yw.text: One of those places they cook in front of you. The meat was delicious and perfectly cooked. The cook was nice and funny. Service was great.

c80rLLjVPyE1FrdKdOd1VQ.text: We love this place!  Great staff , excellent service and yummy food cooked right at your table.  This is a much better option than Benihana.  The chef's always put on a good show, and have lots of fun with the guests at the table.  Also if you like sushi, it is some of the best in the Valley!  Additionally they have a very generous happy hour everyday until 7pm.

QJ7Gbfp6S9MfKo5VZwJBkw.text: I'm a big teppanyaki lover and I've tried several different places but I wasn't too impressed with the way they prepare the food here. I ordered the filet and shrimp and the shrimp was like rubber. It tasted like it wasn't cooked all the way and it was very disappointing. The Filet was good but I've definitely had better from other places. They offer chicken fried rice for 2.50 extra and our chef drowned it in soy sauce so it almost looked like soup when he put it in the bowl. Everyone loves chicken fired rice and he just ruined it!   The best part is when they toss the shrimp to see if you can catch it in your mouth. If your lucky enough you may get a shot and they give you free sake.   I haven't tried the Kobe steak yet, it is super expensive unless you are out for a special occasion. A lot of other reviewers seem to like the sushi.  I guess I'll have to miss out because I won't be coming back. I'll just keep going back to Benihana's! They never disappoint.

fk6iMCodVq92D0LfoB5a_Q.text: First time here, i was really excited for the experience..... but fail.  I came here for a birthday party. Party of 9. Everybody was there on time and of course 15 minutes late even though we had a reservation...  It took 20 minutes to get our drinks. Another 20 minutes to get my two order of sushi. I had to get up and ask for hot water and low sodium soy sauce. The server didn't seem to care for her job really. She took her time for everything.  Conner.. he was a great chef! Showing his skills at the table and entertaining us with his jokes. He was phenomenal!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Kobe Teppan & Sushi - Tempe, AZ, United States. Spicy tuna roll and the garden roll

wzQTqzgp_TgOAEx2pALJ_A.text: I love this restaurant, I come here often for work events and for lunch: their service is excellent and friendly, the food is delicious and the price is always right.  This place is as good, or better, than the other well known Teppan place over by Chandler Fashion Square Mall.  This last May, I needed a place for my daughter's high school graduation dinner for the whole extended family at 4 PM.  Unfortunately, the 4 PM time was not-negotiable since my daughter had to be at her high school and ready to walk in the ceremony at 6:15 sharp.  When I explained my quandary to the restaurant, not only did they offer to open a half hour early just for our dinner party, but they were accommodating in every other way and the service and food was stellar.  My dinner guests all raved about how good their food was afterwards.    Thank you, Kobe!

JMBs-8pMjSxafyxaPjWHNw.text: I always get the best service and food here! The lady that served us was super nice and always made sure our drinks were filled. The habachi master was super funny and nice! Loved the food and service and love how considerate they are. I ordered the veggie and tofu which of course made them think I was vegetarian so when he offered everyone shrimp he asked me first if I wanted some. So yays! Thank you for another great experience!

GJVohSsyYX2lHfoSccefnA.text: This place has been my Brother and my favorite for teppenyaki. We always request June, who is a lot of fun and really gets the table going! The service is good. There have been a few times where they've run out of Sake, Royal Crown and Sapporo Beer. This place has been usually great! Waitresses are very nice and work hard. Great place to bring family or a night out with friends! I will continue being a regular.

ugUwsod21D6kWXRcdYTcYA.text: I made a reservation for 8 O'Clock for 5. I was advised they could only hold the reservation for 10 minutes and if our entire party was not their by 8:10 we lose the reservation. We all arrived by 7:50. We waited to be seated precisely till 8:30. We keep asking if we can be seated and we were told 15 minutes at 8:05. A larger party was seated ahead of us. Please explain why it is appropriate for me to lose my reservation but it is acceptable for your staff to keep people waiting longer than their reservation? My party and I will not come back. Inexcusable. Please have your staff trained more adequately and provide better service rather than staring at guests not providing any update.

swlruaT4nsCWD8cGLD0JjA.text: Great atmosphere, and the waitress was attentive while taking orders ! The chef was a younger guy was just ok ! Didn't think the Fried rice was great but the miso soup and salad yummy! My sashimi very tasty and the New York Strip and shrimp yummy! Added tip of our party of 6! Squirting Sake and tossing shrimp to catch in your mouth Lots of Fun! Overall it was good!

M_YIWO3xm0Ma611OTfISBg.text: hands down, my FAVE sushi place close to work and home everyone is so nice food is great and prices are pocket friendly:)

61fjWzNQZPSaIRPECNUw8w.text: We had driven by here for years and never stopped in.  Gave it a try and are now HOOKED!  Everything was fresh and delicious.  We showed up at opening time on a Sunday and were the only ones in the teppan area.  Quick service.  Cook Trevor gave a great performance after first checking for food allergies.  All dishes were delicious.  Lunch portions are HUGE!  Wish we had come by here years ago!  Please give them a try!

S00GgasK4-VvdneKHbkmyQ.text: I've been to this restaurant quite a few times and have never had to wait so long for food in my life as I have tonight. After being told it would take 20 minutes to be seated it took upwards of 30 minutes. After being seated it took 40+ minutes to receive the (1) sushi roll I ordered. In the process of waiting with my (1) other friend I watched a family of (8) who arrived 10 minutes after we did receive their food 10 minutes prior to my own food. The waiter was polite and apologetic but obviously their kitchen staff and management have no idea how to treat their customers. I won't ever go back.

QR9deYKZ7-ENwf2bMMYiOA.text: Its okay here.  I guess if you live on this side of town or are around here to eat its good; however if you can go to osaka its better.

1lmwekKGXoNiQKCCNHdPuQ.text: So we made reservations at Kobe for a Saturday night and the event that we were at prior went a little longer than expected. We went ahead and called Kobe and they were extremely friendly and let us keep our reservation and just pushed it back thirty minutes which was great. When seated at the table I was with a party of four including myself and the rest of the table was another party of four and a party of two. You're given a server as well as the cook. The server was kind but seemed all over the place and very confused the entire night. This only got worse as the dinner went on. The cook was great, cooked the food entertainingly, and had a great personality while doing it. As we were seated right away she asked us what we wanted to drink which to me is fine because I was just going to get my go to which is lemonade, for I believe fifty cents extra you can get a flavor lemonade so I got the strawberry which was a little to sweet for me. One of the people that was in my party asked if they had a certain kind of wine and the server seemed to have no idea what so ever which is fine but like I said earlier she just really didn't seem like she was mentally present at all.  We didn't get any appetizers because your meal comes with a salad, miso soup, rice and a Shrimp appetizer. By the time I get to my meal I'm already having to undo a button on my pants! So whoever said its not a lot of food is crazy! The salad: First things first, the dressing on this salad is to die for. I believe it's some sort of ginger dressing but it's delicious. Salad as a whole though, ehhh. They sort of only put dressing on the top and the bowl is kind of small so it's hard to mix in the dressing so the lettuce on the bottom gets none. I ended up only eating the lettuce on top. Which is fine, I needed the stomach room for my food anyways! The Soup: I love miso soup. And theirs was good. The rice: For about two dollars extra you can upgrade to chicken fried rice instead of just steamed rice. Upgraded, it's worth the extra cost! They throw eggs and chicken in the rice and it's absolutely delicious. Shrimp Appetizer: Its just three pieces of shrimp which are delicious but I'm not sure I would call it a appetizer. Next was the actual dinner! I was really feeling seafood so I got what I believe is called the seafood delight, it comes with shrimp, scallops, and lobster. It was absolutely delicious. Then two other people in my party got the filet mignon and lobster tail combo, and the last person got sword fish. Tried the sword fish and it was cooked really well and had a good flavor, and tried the filet mignon and he cooked them absolutely perfect.  When it came to splitting checks and paying it was a complete mess for the entire table. The server had to go back and resolution them and fix them twice because it was done wrong and it felt as if it took forever.  Meanwhile the whole dinner the waitress was nowhere to be seen. I really wanted a water so I had to flag her down which I hate doing. For one of the brief moments she was at our table she dropped an entire full cup of water on a lady across the table from me and it was completely all over her and the glass actually ended up in her purse spilling the rest. YIKES. Needless to say, she looked like she went swimming. I felt bad for the server of course, I work in a restaurant too, it happens to the best of us. But she didn't say she was sorry or anything which kind of surprised me. At the end of the meal the couple ended up getting extremely upset because they never got an apology, no manager ever came by to say anything, and their bill despite everything remained the same. They then asked to see a manager to say something about it and the manager herself said that they don't control their staff and can't control what they mess up on so they can't be held liable...YIKES TIMES TWO. What do you mean you can't be held liable, they're your staff at your restaurant??? They just didn't want to give any discount or anything. This horrible level of customer service really bothered me.  Over all the food great! Service ehh, not so great. For about the same price I have had better experiences at Benihana.

GlshktaoWGoNLWYkpg7tzA.text: The place needs to be cleaned front to back. My tea cup had lipstick on the rim, the next cup had a hair in the tea. Not a good start to lunch. The Tempura my wife ordered came nice and hot but was not cooked long enough. the tuna roll I ordered was good. The Bento Box took way too long to get to the table, was not hot and had been sitting about 10 min. before brought out to the table. You could tell the staff was not trying to please anyone. The meat in the Bento Box was good meat. The rice was a blob.  I find that good Japanese restaurant's have high standard's for cleanliness food and staff. I did not find that necessarily here.

fZo1OSXWHYMYs6kMOKAqrA.text: Me and my wife went for the first time and had a blast. Fun environment and GREAT food. I want to come back with the kids. Thank you KOBE for a awesome dinner and entertainment.

photos.caption: Photo of Kobe Teppan & Sushi - Tempe, AZ, United States. The Godzilla was delicious

UxAo9AHTjdOaPqPMUfM2-Q.text: Went in on Feb 20th., our waitress was Haley... she was so sweet and very attentive. Our meal was delicious and very reasonably priced! Been here before but definitely the best service we've ever had there.

grd-nuGSoffX22G1SNw4Tg.text: Came in for dinner in february 2017, haley was awesome, she was very attentive and super sweet! the sushi was really good too!

PJ7ghGbOlE7A1SAqh_nT2g.text: We went on a Monday, no problem getting a seat at the tepanyaki table. It was 3 of us and we were seated with another family for 4, so it made it more fun.  I started with some sushi that was really good.  The grilling dude was ok, kinda funny but same old jokes when you have been to these types of restaurants. Still had a great time.  I had the seafood trio with a side of filet, man that was outstanding ! Great food. Wife had the Grilled fish, that was excellent as well ! Definately will go back ! Would love to go on a weekend when its more livelier !

q-a5U38-wHS1qZ9y71wQng.text: The wait from walking into the door to getting our food was about 30 minutes so this might not be the best option when you're in a rush or looking for a quick dinner. Our chef was hilarious and definitely kept us laughing. The food is good and the place is very clean! It looks sketchy from the outside especially at night but it is very family friendly! Price is average for this kind of restaurant and food.

LArktAdNrqx8HgwjmTeIyw.text: We have come to Kobe numerous times and it's always been amazing. Tonight we had a new cook, Conner, he was FRIGGIN AWESOME. Best teppan chef ever. We were all laughing so hard we couldn't even eat. I will request him every time I come back!

sZNnH1rlFXITZ599l2aLZw.text: Horrible customer service. We have been here several times over the past few years and it just seems to be going down hill. We came in for dinner on Thursday at 5:00. The doors were not opened till about 5:10. We were the first to be seated and sat for about 15 min. Before the waitress came by to take our drink order. While everyone else that got seated after us already had their drinks. We sat for another 10 minutes, still no drinks. By that time we decided to just get up and walk out. On our way out we let the hostess know we were leaving and the manager was there too and didn't say anything. I guess they just don't care about their customers.

A--77SQScFYvik1_HhX-WQ.text: We absolutely LOVED the Teppan here, Primarily because of our Chef, He was AWESOME!. I don't think i've ever had a Teppan chef who was as involved with his patrons as ours was. I can also say I have never had SAKE directly squirted into my mouth by a Teppan Chef lol...   The food was good too and I would totally recommend the Mushroom tempura. We will definitelt be back before we leave AZ.

LZhXta6jiKV6Eb-D-Y00kA.text: My favorite tappan- yakki place to go to. My favorite chefs are Allen and June. Very funny and very entertaining!

VS9gYIWlmcG2lCX7mQ0ZyQ.text: Even though I went there with a group of my gal pals, I couldn't help thinking that Kobe is a great place for first dates.  Or a large group of at least eight...it gets awkward sitting with perfect strangers.  Four of our eight were no shows, so we ended up sharing. And they won't seat you until your entire party is present either.  Anyway, the place is entertaining and quaint at the same time.  While I may not be running back soon, it's a definite spot to check off your dining-out experience list.  The food and drinks were done well but not enough for my taste buds to scream senselessly about.

SbCoE6CBOt-hkpn0bf27fQ.text: This gigantic place is divided into several different restaurant types and a bar. Sushi counter, teppanyaki grills, a room with booths for serving typical Asian dishes, and a happy hour bar. We tried the teppanyaki and had a great time, luckily for us our cook and the other guests at our table were a hoot - not to mention the excellent quality of the ingredients. I will be back!
