I_5s5YHKWF-X6VZaitAAJg.text: Went there today for lunch. Good as always! Decent prices for lunch as well. Chicken was a little on the dry side today, but that's not the usual.

V0GlmLvCqXnAl7IAtTI0oQ.text: Me, my girlfriend, sister and my nephew first walked in and were told it would be a fifteen minute wait, on a wed night. After waiting outside for twenty and walking back in, the hosts failed to acknowledge us and we proceeded to wait another 10 minutes. They then explained it would be just a few minutes from there. 15 minutes go by and i have to walk back up to them to where they explained it would actually be another 45 minute wait to an hour...on a Wednesday night. These two un-ambitious and clueless hosts could not be decent enough to give us a straight answer or keep us up to date. Now I'm in Red Robin getting high cholesterol contemplating my life. I wish i could write a review on the food but nah.

LqwukFdosBEVcHQj9Pb53g.text: This is my favorite sushi in Arizona but their service is the worst I've ever experienced. Tonight was the third time I called in wanting take out from the sushi bar and was declined because they are "too busy". The last time they said that I drove the THIRTY MINUTES from my house to dine in and they weren't even busy. Even if you are, just take my order and say it will be like an hour. How hard is that? You guys really suck and you've lost a LONG time customer that honestly came in like twice per week. Good job.

V4rreBswMO9IR6WdVfu0Vg.text: I have to say that I was glad to find a Kobe here in AZ, as I've been to Kobe back home in HI, and was always satisfied. Overall, this AZ Kobe's isn't bad. I mean, if you've never experienced tepenyaki, it's probably worth a shot. You typically can't go wrong with Kobe beef anyway. However, if you're also looking for good sushi in the desert I may recommend looking at other options. Overall, it really was not bad, but also not super good especially for the price. I think you're primarily paying for the tepenyaki experience here. On the bright side, we did meet an intrersting couple, as is expected with this type of dining, and they gave us another recommendation to check out.

LsY5_031PSPKv2cAev6pPw.text: Holy Shashmi Salad!  Good food and the Shashimi salad is great here too... Teppanyaki style spot with the cooking taking place as a part of the show in front of you.    Friendly staff  Good happy hour specials  Good for events and groups....

hwLKpqc4_lzELzfwuYUpqQ.text: For a grumbling stomach I had to try Kobe as I have driven by it several times. I would say it's an average pick but of course that could be my first time around and partly because the choices I made were of the ordinary.   For a Tuesday night the restaurant was not too bad but the Sushi bar was empty. Which is where we sat. They do have teppanyaki tables for the all fun entertainment.   We were seated quickly since there wasn't much of a crowd. Beverages were given within the first few minutes. Ordering took a bit longer than I would have expected. They have a sushi menu that you mark with a dry erase marker and then a full menu.   Picks of my night: - pickled cucumber slices with sprinkled sesame seeds with your ginger and wasabi. Free with your sushi order.   - 2 choice sashimi: yellowtail (hamachi) and salmon (sake) with 3 pieces each for a total of $14. Ehh not my kinda price for slices that could be a bit thicker. Taste was Normal as can be.   - Alaska roll: California roll (for you all that are not so adventurous) with salmon on top. This wasn't anything out of the ordinary. $8.50  - chicken udon stir fry: a well-cooked plate. Smells resonated within a nose distance! I'd say if you're looking for a hot plate this would be it. Seasoned cubed chicken, thin julienned carrots, scallions, all mixed in the thick rice udon noodle. The dinner plate was a bit small for a dinner portion. $9  Overall: decent food for Japanese restaurant.

yuHTQxj-mmuQHSIgrS5X_g.text: Mediocre at best. Service was okay but they put our food at the wrong table and took off so fast the table that got the wrong food brought it to us. The stuffed shrimp appetizer was great though. The spicy tuna roll was good but over top with spice.

fCYF64XCnrJ4m0eusAIITw.text: I went here for a friend's birthday and we had a really fun time! The service was a little slow but our chef explained that they were short staffed because of their head chef leaving. We didn't mind waiting since we were celebrating and spending time with each other. As a vegetarian I loved that they had tofu on the menu (a lot of similar places I've been to just do veggies and no meat). Our hostess was also excellent and made sure to find out how to divide up checks with our large group. Overall it was a good experience and I would recommend it!

n9T-PnQY5TIw4SYROkGSOg.text: This place is AWESOME. I have eaten a lot of Japanese food and have seen every trick in the book on the grill. Our chief blow me away with all his tricks. Food was great.

mq2zb4G1rE2IpGn8ZnKb_A.text: The teppan is a fun experience here! The chefs are really entertaining and the food hasn't disappointed me yet.    The fried rice is delicious instead of white rice with your teppan meal.  I always order the Sashimi salad with jalepenos for an appetizer. It is a big portion and I think its only $5.99  They have happy hour during the day that includes appetizers, sushi and alcoholic beverages.

Qk7HT2ghd2qulOON1Fn7Nw.text: Ordered take out hibachi from here for my birthday last Sunday & I wasn't too impressed.   First, placing the order took 20 minutes (no lie) because the host wasn't understanding my order. I ordered two sushi rolls, fillet/shrimp combo dinner and chicken/lobster combo dinner. The host put me on hold for 6 minutes because he couldn't figure out his to ring it up. Still I was being patient, so he didn't ask how I wanted my steak cooked, so I said I would like the fillet to be medium rare, he said okay. Then he hung up on me!! I was so appalled because I was not rude to him at all!  So we go & get our order. We are missing the dipping sauces that come with the hibachi meals, we had a wrong sushi roll & my steak was well done.   I was not impressed with this at all because our meal was a little over 100! When I called the restaurant no one wanted to help or seemed to care what I saying.   It's a shame because of what I did eat, the food was good. Just terrible service. Maybe if we ate there it would have been different. But that shouldn't naked a difference.

OlScTze_70doFslhe-nv6g.text: . Always have great experiences here and today was no exception. A good happy hour to entertain while you wait.

X7wL8ACprLlzXsjfdpM5pA.text: My 2 daughters and I met a friend at Kobe on a Saturday evening. She's a regular customer here but it was our first time.   Customer service: The 4 girls in the front weren't all that friendly. No one smiled or greeted us as we walked in or when we were leaving the restaurant either.. I didn't understand that.   Cook: We requested Jorge as our cook, since my friend comes in a lot and said he's the best. He truly was amazing! He was so engaging with all of us. My little girls are 7 & 9 and he just made their experience memorable. This was their first teppen grill so I appreciated that a whole lot.   Food was good. Very flavorful! I wish they had more vegetarian options but it was tasty.   We will definitely be back and will request Jorge again. If it weren't for him, our first experience at Kobe would have been our last.

Nqv1ViYCdo7CtBxWcd3A9g.text: If you like water down sake and over seasoned overpriced yakisoba this is the place for you. Also if you like to mention to the establishment three times about a birthday and still receive no birthday greeting they've got you covered.

9i4bvLk2Sex-ivzk9f8M0A.text: We have been going to Kobe for a while and always enjoyed the service and fantastic happy hour prices in the bar. For whatever reason, this evening's dinner was a catastrophe - our waitress failed to provide quality service, was not very pleasant, and we didn't receive several of of the dishes we ordered. When we inquired about our orders, she would respond "you still wanted that?".  Debating whether or not it's worth returning :(

xdIO779shIQ_aOo7d2YC8w.text: Awesome happy hour specials ! Sushi is delicious and fresh ! I love their chicken fried rice as well... and cannot beat their happy hour specials compared to other places

iZl0MZjT40LMgRrK7NdL0Q.text: Would give zero stars if I could called at 1:30 asked for a reservation for lunch during weekday on a Thursday they said walk in before 2 o'clock do not need a reservation not busy whatsoever was there at 1:55 wooden seat meet for lunch Told me I was too late then after talking to the manager they told me if I know what I want I could order right now but could order fried rice court order this court order that I've had it terrible did not care and basically called me a liar when I said I spoke to the girl if she told me I didn't need reservations to walk-in will never return this is my first review on yelp and I'm sorry to say it's a terrible one

O-W71FCwX7APV-YTSRy7rg.text: I enjoy coming here for their happy hour. Whenever I visit we either sit at the bar or the sushi bar. The customer service needs some improvement, there was nothing special, everyone was nice, no conversation starters or anything. The place is always pretty empty when I visit, except the teppan area.   I usually order gyoza, chicken terriyaki bowl and assortments of sushi in the HH menu. They have pan fried and steamed gyoza. I prefer the fried gyoza because it gives it a little crunch and brings out the flavors more. The chicken terriyaki is average. I enjoy their sushi but I notice the consistency of the rice changes with whoever is making it. I do like that it's not too noisy. The bartenders are cool and fun to talk to when we sit their. I was convinced into ordering the popular Godzilla drink which I really enjoyed.

FYFUQhAIZrILGGOQrE-9hA.text: First time here it was not bad. I enjoyed the interaction that the chefs gave especially for a big party of mine! I would go again

M-nL9crLAF1ot6b7d2WJzw.text: I'm a regular - my service club meets here every week and I never tire of their Japanese lunches. We have a choice of several, and they are all great. Best of all, the service is fantastic! It's so good that I'm in another group that now meets there every other week. They have a very nice party room, we get happy hour prices and the service, again, is top-notch. I love Kobe!

5KwjWh-aUwHWeDe_Zti8jg.text: The chef was fun - very deadpan and quietly hilarious. You almost miss his jokes if you don't pay attention and listen. But the food is pretty subpar. The fried rice is very greasy and flavorfless. I had to douse mine in soy sauce. The shrimp was good and the steaks were cooked properly medium rare or medium as requested by each person in our group. But the veggies side was also very flavorless and greasy. WAY too much butter is used and no seasoning whatsoever (minus a bit of pepper and soy sauce which is all overpowered by the butter).

FJA5vmj4ngZ-xiKuqFsESw.text: My boyfriend and I found Kobe almost a year ago and have been several times for lunch, dinner and happy hour. We abosolutley love the place.  The food, service, menu selection and prices make Benihanna a waste if time. The Kobe beef is totally worth the price. They have several entrees and sides to choose from and the sushi is fabulous.  If you want a nice meal at a reasonable price then go for lunch. Happy hour is from 3 to 7 EVERYDAY! There are only a handful of restaurants that we will go to and this is one of them.  Totally amazing food experience.

xGEFiMTY3GfEB4vlyuV8WA.text: Oh my god, this place was abysmal.   My dinner partner and I had planned on going to Sushi Eye for happy hour last night, but after driving up and down Elliot 4 or 5 times without finding it and with the end of happy hour quickly approaching, we finally pulled into Kobe out of sheer desperation. Biggest mistake ever.   So, the hostess asks us whether we want sushi or teppan, and we say sushi. Then, sushi bar or table? We've got some talking to do, so we say table. Once we're seated at a table with menus, our eyes pop out of our heads when we see the sushi prices. Like, we're talking $8 spicy tuna rolls. So we ask the waiter whether there are any happy hour specials. He says, "Yes, but we only have happy hour at the sushi bar, not at the tables." Hmm, okay. So we move to the sushi bar and ask for a happy hour menu. The waiter says, "Oh, you mean happy hour sushi? I thought you meant drinks. At the sushi bar we only do happy hour drinks. If you want happy hour sushi, you have to sit at the main bar." So, we've been there for 3 minutes and moved twice. Not exactly auspicious beginnings.  It only got worse from there. There are two happy hour sushi specials: spicy tuna roll and california roll, both $3.25. We were starving so we ordered two of each, plus Kobe tofu and pork gyoza (both also on happy hour special for $3.25).   It was the worst sushi I've ever had, and I've had a lot of sushi. The california roll was horrendous. It was 95% imitation crab and mayonnaise, with teeny slivers of cucumber and brown avocado. The spicy tuna roll, though not as actively offensive as the california roll, was boring and mushy. The Kobe tofu was bland and had an oddly spiced dipping sauce - eating it was reminiscent of eating McDonald's chicken nuggets dipped in sweet and sour sauce. And not in a good way. The pork gyoza, though, was wonderful, though at $3.25 for 5 of them, it was not enough of a bargain to warrant a return trip.   And all, the while, since the place is (for whatever reason) really busy, we're stuck at the end of the bar, where we have to listen to the world's most obnoxious waitress prattle on to the bartender about how she's soooooo tired of all these women glaring at her because they think she's after their men, and how she wants to "get a t-shirt that says, "Honey, I'm not after what you've got because I've got my own stuff to deal with at home." Wow. Witty.   Anyway, this place is awful and I'll never be back. Luckily, we finally found Sushi Eye on the way home (hiding sneakily between a Quizno's and a Baja Fresh, if memory serves) and hopefully we'll have a more pleasant happy hour experience next week. Sigh.

rYVAFSaxSrc8eGdQLxnNtw.text: I'd call this place a poor man's Ichi Ban except it's more expensive.  I went there on Sunday night and it was pretty dead.  Right as we were getting situated, a waitress walked into the room with a tray of drinks and promptly dropped half of them in a loud crash.  I would consider that excellent foreshadowing and a metaphor for the overall dining experience.    First we had to wait forever because we were the only ones at our table.  After asking if it would be much longer, they said you have to wait 15 minutes and 10 had already passed so we decided to invest another 5 minutes hoping for some sort of payoff in the end.  Ten minutes later, we finally got to place our order after we asked again.    In a nutshell: the salad and soup were nothing special, my fork was dirty, and the entrees were bland and burnt.  There didn't seem to be much seasoning used, if any.  Definitely not as good as Ichi Ban and the meals cost about $5 more, plus they charge $2.00 extra for fried rice, unlike at Ichi Ban where fried rice is free.  I was glad when we finally got out of there and I don't plan on going back.

BOH_cyhtt3izDJU874b1qg.text: Kobe just barely deserves three stars, and here's why.  The food is a wild mix of "I've had much better at Shogun Express", to "Wow!  This is really tasty."  The service was another mixed bag.  Our server wasn't on the ball, but some of the others covered for him.  I'm not sure exactly how long they've been open, so the service may improve.  Overall, I feel comfortable saying that you don't get what you pay for.  Last night, my wife and I met a friend at Kobe for dinner.  We started off with an order of Gyoza; it was served warm-ish.  I almost sent it back to be heated up, but had a feeling they'd just throw it in the microwave.  The flavor was good, but nothing special.    Our Gyoza was followed by Ginger salads and Miso soup.  As our friend said, Miso soup is tough to mess up.  It happens, but not often.  Luckily, Kobe's was just fine.  As was the salad, which consisted of iceberg lettuce, a cherry tomato, a couple strands of carrot, and the only thing capable of saving such a pathetic salad, some yummy ginger dressing.  The ladies ordered sushi and both really enjoyed their rolls.  As I'm not a sushi eater (I know, I know, shoot me now!), I can't really comment on the quality other than the girls' reactions and comments, which were mostly (if not completely) positive.    I, on the other hand, ordered a cucumber roll and the teriyaki chicken and steak combo.  A cucumber roll is another one of those really difficult things to screw up.  There's was just fine.  The teriyaki dish was the worst teriyaki chicken/steak I've had in recent memory.  The meat was a dry and the rice was either over cooked, or had been sitting out too long like the Gyoza.  For desert, we ordered a mango sorbe and a vanilla tempura (read fried) ice cream.  Neither were anything to write home about, but neither were bad either, which is exactly how I'd characterize the restaurant.  Although I didn't try the entire menu, my recommendation is that you stick to sushi and miso soup.

B4YFSIz8pttz83tGEX-dmQ.text: I am shocked to see such a low rating for Kobe and Benihana gets more stars? Seriously? I noticed most of the reviews are for sushi here and I have only had tepanyaki. We had a great experience here. Granted the miso and salad are nothing to rave about, but are they ever? You don't go to tepan for miso and salad with ginger dressing. My experience here was better in every way, shape and form compared to the Benihana in Scottsdale, but thats a whole other review.  We were seated promptly and or drink orders were taken while we waited 5 min for our table to fill up. They took our orders as we were ready to give them and we waited for our chef. He was seriously a lot of fun, I wish I could remember his name! They might charge an extra $2 for fried rice but the free saki shots made up for that. Our food was prepared perfectly as ordered and we got the standard flipping food at someones mouth and one of the better onion volcanos I've seen. I'm sad to see this place have such a low rating as my experience was great!

ryNqIyrspPVPZC4lMNaIxQ.text: I love this place! I have been here for several Birthday celebrations! We like to go to the Teppan table. It is nice if you have a group of at least 4, it makes it more fun when you are sitting with people you enjoy and know they are on the same level as you are! When I go with my friends we like the dinner and show! We always participate in trying to catch shrimp and saki in your mouth! It is fun if you don't mind getting a little messy! I always arrive happy and leave even happier! Always get the steak and chicken and of course fried rice. I have ordered sushi there as well and it is delightful especially when you sit in the bar/sushi table for happy hour! Good deals for good food.

DxIrJ68RE7lWzIuZBEQKTA.text: I go here often because it is a reliable sushi place with teppanyaki (sp?).  The service is friendly the times I've been here.  The sushi is good with a deep list and reasonably priced.  One time that I ordered takeout, though, they forgot to include my salad and soup.  The teppan show is very entertaining.  The chefs do their magic and feed you fast!  We always order their chicken yakisoba and it is full of chicken and shrimp but it can be a bit too oily.  I do recall having a great Mai Tai which is big in my book!

kvJl7l9wTPEW-G79PlmxvA.text: The food was great. Kobe was excellent but the scallops were a little overdone. We went on a Sunday night and our chef was tired from the weekend or so he said. No real show, nothing fancy, did a couple of tricks and we tried to jolly him up a bit but it didn't work. The only issue I could see to another night was the group seating. I must be getting old but if I am paying $50 a person, I don't want cranky, crying kids right next to me.  Not the restaurants fault but really!!!! Who takes kids that need high chairs to this kind of restaurant?

tPBGPuqW4PuA3LavsC0_7w.text: The problem here people, is that sushi should be had at a sushi restaurant when in Arizona. Not Kobe. Try Sushi Eye down the street for that.  Waiting for a table to fill can suck. Getting squished into a table of 8, when you only have 2 sucks too.  For teppanyaki, this place is a-OK for a while. Once you eat here a few times, you start to realize that not all the chefs can actually cook. You have to find the chef you like, and stick with them.   Also, after a while it all tastes the same. This place is really good, when you have not had it in a few weeks/months.  Salad and soup, not so good. Tell them to keep it!  The cooking experience can be fun for someone who has not been there before, or for children. Who doesn't love a beating heart made from fried rice, or a fire shooting train when the lights are dimmed?  Overall its good. Nicer place than Ichi Ban. And way way better than the local Benihana. (Not sure why the Benihana in AZ suck, they are great in CA)

d-56r1-6Wgv6B6B9v0WF5Q.text: I cant say that I really enjoyed having lunch here today.  The sushi was so so.  The mushroom tempura was actually pretty tasty, everything else, not so much.  I never really pay attention to the prices when I eat sushi, so I can't tell you how expensive it was.  I can tell you this - I have had better.  I think this is the first time I have had sushi that I couldnt actually taste the fish in the heavy sauces that were used.  The tea was really good, I didnt have to add sugar to it, which is not the norm for me.  I didnt have any drinks, which I should have, because I was already having a horrible day.  Kind of disappointing, I had been looking forward to this place since I saw them putting it in a while back.  Probably wont go back.

iT9NaP0rOaj-5jpcuOMDFQ.text: I am disappointed. I would occasionally come in to get away from the lunch crush, take a seat in the back booths, and order a good Hibachi meal. I come in yesterday and was told they recently stopped doing that. Now I understand, your house your rules. But I don't have the time to wait through an entire flair, I've got to eat and get back to work. I ended up leaving without lunch, damn shame too, great food. I hope I'll come back during dinner when I'm not pressed for time.

Kq8EEKBlAHgejnyzjdY5MA.text: The sashimi is fresh, cold, and excellent quality.  Yes, it's a little more expensive than the grocery store.  However, Kobe is well worth it if you have the discriminating palate to appreciate the quality.  They had (at the time) fresh scallops still in the shell.  pretty expensive, but the sushi chef let me hold the shell and show my boy the "before" state of our meal.     Service is good, but if you go to a *real* sushi restaurant, you have to accept a certain level of language barrier.  Communicate clearly and adapt or go to McDonald's.

Y32UlMJoT2L4tkVT6psvLA.text: It was Valentine's Day,. my girl friend and I were having a double date with our friends. We usually get the tepen, but all the the seats reserved. So we decided to do dine in. I ordered the unagi dish. For some reason it took them awhile for me to get it. When I finally got the dish, it was ice cold. I can think of two scenarios on why it was ice cold. 1. It  was made and forgotten about a left on the counter. 2. Somebody else ordered it and didn't want it, so did they decided to give it to me instead of making me a fresh one. Either way I had to eat cold food. I probably could have told them it was cold and they probably could have fixed it. But my judgement is on how they got it done the first time, not how they can make up for it. A good excuse on why it was cold would have been that it's supposed to be served cold, but I've ordered this dish in the past it was always served hot or at least warm.

fxwL_s5DB-jKL0OqL51Ghw.text: Fantastic place for the evening. You'll never leave disappointed.  Try the Lobster or some sushi.  Super fresh and done very well.

maBe6J_QSeYlAa1YNkAyVA.text: Okay... so I think the food is really, really good here, what with the use of all of that extra sweet, salty, delicious creamery butter that they add to everything to cook it in front of you... so very, very tasty... and heart-stopping! But tasty, oh, yessss...   Here's the thing, though - the food is not consistent. We had a party of 6 and shared the table with another party of 4 and everyone had a different protein. So on our side, there was one who ordered chicken, two with scallops, one with shrimp, and two with filet. The chef comes out and gets to work on rice: some had fried and some had steamed. Steamed was served first and the bowl of rice just sat in front of the customer as there was nothing to go with it yet. Then the fried rice was cooked and served, but again, that food sat untouched. Scallops were cooked first and distributed to the two people who ordered them, but veggies were not cooked yet and no one else's food was either, so the scallops sat on the plates, untouched. Next was shrimp, then filet, then finally chicken, and THEN veggies. when the Veggies were finally served the chef scooped from a large pile of sauteed vegetables and started serving the table from the inside out, so the first three people on either side of the table got the large chunks of vegetables, and the people in the outer three chairs were served what was left, which was little slivers of overcooked, mostly onions. By then my scallops, which were seared to perfection, were cold, as was my rice. The food was very tasty and seasoned correctly but most of my food was cold when I was able to finally start eating.   For $25 a plate there's gotta be a better way than this, doesn't there?

MGWjF9Htv2NWhhyYXEab-w.text: Went with our friends on a last minute thing.  We got in fast.  The show was good the kids loved it.   The food was awesome. The sushi that I had was great.   The decor was really nice and clean.

QnoPYcSl3VCJuf8r6wLA8g.text: This place is all about what they cannot do or will do and if they do what you ask they will charge you.  I asked for two California Rolls one with no cucumber.  When it was brought to the waiter's attention, the waiter took the roll back to the person who made sushi.  His resolve was to throw some cucumber on the plate and advise us if we wanted cucumber in the roll we would now have to place it there ourselves even though it was his mistake.  During the time at another table a lady ordered a second dish which came with salad.  She already had salad and wanted soup.  She was told there was no button to subsitute the salad so he would have to charge her for the soup.  He then told her on the bright side, the salad she was now getting had a different salad dressing than the previous one she had eaten.  Funny how I ordered the tempura and there was a button to charge for teriyaki sauce but no substitution.  It was an add on.  After getting tired of them telling us and other tables what they could not do, or would not serve, I cancelled the order and left.  I remember visiting this place a previous time vowing I would never go back because of the lack of service and making dishes with condiments I wanted or being charged for substitution or straight out refusals to make an item my way.  I will NOT be returning to this dump ever again.  It is not the staff but someone who has trained them to make no changes or substitutions without charging or at all.  It is really sad cause the atmosphere is nice but the service really sucks at this place,  Do not patronize this type of behavior cause I know I am not going to.

3PiXuuj09ZDl9nHdUt5yYg.text: Ive gone 2 a million Teppan restaurants in my life. This 1 was probably the worst. Our chef was bland w/o any tricks & the food wasnt worth the price. However, thr party across from us appeared 2 b havn fun with the chef. Hopefully u get him

4-zCD71Qxq7twpZO4CXWlQ.text: Pretty good teppenyaki.  The show is fun and worth a visit.

GKedhHlFgfwRowbqY0En_Q.text: Although I havent tried the Teppan part of the restaurant, the service and sushi wasnt good. Sushi wasnt fresh and a waiter passed by us several times, about 10 minutes without helping or saying if someone helped us.

wta9qiScZN6JbngMUhDwew.text: Our family of 4 adults was very pleased with everything from beginning to end.  The service was attentive, but not rushed, the food was fresh and tasty, and the seasonings were spot on.  The sashimi was very fresh and well presented.  The teppan chef was friendly and entertaining.  We were pleased to find a hibachi steakhouse which hit the mark.  We will be going back here.

C-hqt4DGigmRA8Lqpk0kLw.text: To be honest I came here looking for a new good place to get sushi. And after seeing all the reviews that praised it I decided to give it a try. Sadly the reviews were far from the truth. I've heard restaurants reaching out to people to write good views on yelp and to be honest I wouldn't be surprised if this was the case. Yes the restaurant was beautifully decorated, it looked promising at first with good costumer service and the decorations. Me and my boyfriend ordered each sashimi and a roll. I got a rainbow roll, usually try a roll I know pretty well when trying new sushi places. The sashimi tasted quite warm and not very fresh. Reminded me of McDonald's food when they freeze, unfreeze, freeze then cook their food. The furtherest from fresh I've ever had. The roll wasn't impressive or even bearable. The roll was missing a certain taste that comes in all good sushi. And it looked like it was smashed in really fast. The worst part was the wasabi, I'm a huge wasabi fan and very surprised when they brought out a dried out clay of green and called it wasabi. Very disappointed, maybe I caught the chef on a bad day or maybe I shouldn't trust yelp as much as I should!

2zy6rmCT_ppXN0MRh_4yxg.text: im a huge kobe fan so i  decided to come here for lunch,  wrong move , i called in and placed my order the lady told me it would only be 20 minutes . i got to the restaurant 25 minutes later, paid for my food she then informed me that it would be another 15 minutes. so after 45 minutes of waiting i finally got my food with only 7 minutes left to scarf it down. when i asked her what the hold up was she said they got slammed , which was a lie because there was only 2 other guest in the entire restaurant. very disappointing experience. food was tasty though .

dMvvck0EN9pYGnDlwvVltg.text: We took my sister and brother in law and my 10mo old nephew for a birthday celebration.  It was the best time ever!!! First, we didn't like where we were going to be seated and they quickly moved us to another table so that the baby would get a better view. The service was very good.  We ordered Sushi first and it was amazing!  Very reasonably priced as well.  The sushi came out as it was ready so that it wasn't sitting there waiting for the rest of the orders to be made.  That was a nice way for us to share and try all the sushi.   The men at the table ordered Saki bombs.  They were huge!   The best part of the evening was the show.  My chef knew we had first timers and put on a great show that included everyone at the table.  My nephew was amazed and even ate some of the rice.  So, with that, the food was delicious!!!   I have been to many different steakhouses in many different states.  This by far is one of the best!  I would recommend the filet minion. And if you really want to treat yourself, get the Kobe steak.  It was amazing!

8njQrVHcFdE-RxunGFJ5Eg.text: We eat at Kobe at least a couple times a month. This is by far the best sushi that we have been able to find in the valley, and their happy hour menu is awesome. We sit exclusively at the bar, as the service in the dining rooms seems to be a bit slow. The food is consistently good and our favourite bartenders never disappoint. Love this place!

BBS-cr-mLy7Qbqw2KCpVaQ.text: My experience was pretty good but a problem with the bill has led to me give this place a low rating. We went on my birthday and had their $20 birthday coupon. I specifically asked the waitress if we could order off the happy hour menu before we ordered anything. She said it would be fine as long as we ordered more than $20 off the regular menu. When the bill came she said the manager told us we could either get happy hour prices or $20 off the bill. I wouldn't have ordered $20 worth of full-priced sashimi  a la cart or an extra carafe of sake if I thought this would be the case. I wasn't happy about this and I won't ever go back to this place. The waitress didn't even say "Happy Birthday" to me even though she insisted on looking at my license to verify that it was my birthday. There really isn't anything special about Kobe so I'd suggest you go to RA for sushi and Benihana for teppanyaki.

0OSe24uFSWBs7XooluJvkg.text: We waited a VERY long time. The waitress was not great.. The only thing that was ok was the beer.  The food was eh

HE38BjX8Yis9BNk1XvaOsQ.text: I went here for dinner last night with four other people. I got two sushi rolls (spicy tuna and spicy yellowtail), and we shared the chicken fried rice.   Sushi: Middle of the line. I felt like it was a little bit pricey for what I got. Next time I will make sure we go during happy hour for sushi.  Fried Rice: Amazeballs. I will eat my own body weight in this rice. This rice is the new everything.   Service was friendly and the place had a nice atmosphere. It was pretty dead while we were there, which was fine since we weren't there to make new friends. The bathrooms were nice and clean.

pQq-tYlHb3KrKmtEtGVOcw.text: I came here twice.   The first time I came here the atmosphere seemed great. It was a Saturday night and pretty busy. It was for a friends birthday dinner.   We waited for the rest of the party to arrive before any of us wanted to order dinner. It seemed the waitress was annoyed from the very beginning.   After we decided to order the waitress seemed to careless about our drinks being refilled. She would rudely reach over our plates and in between us without saying "excuse me". Anytime anybody wanted anything she would ignore them as she walked away.   I thought it was just me but we all noticed it. I understand if your waiting on a large party it may seem overwhelming. If that is the case than management should assign two waitress's to the party so that everybody gets what they need.   The food was great and I can't even complain about it because the food had nothing to do with the waitress.   On the second visit back. We went during lunch. It was not happy hour but normal lunch hours. Our waitress didn't even make eye contact or smile or anything at all other than show up at our table to take our order and after our food arrived she asked if we needed anything else after we were almost done. When we needed refills on our drinks she never even offered anybody a refill except for the person who had a empty glass. We finally got refills from the bus boy.   The food was great. I can't say the service is wonderful. The hostess is friendly.   I would go back because I love their sushi but I wish they would get better waitress's who actually care about the customers needs.

DhGABSAkxlZAZHjp3wffFw.text: The focus here is mostly on Tepanyaki, but their sushi and rolls are equally notable.  The prices are a bit on the high side, so we only really go here for special occasions.  Their fish quality has been good on every visit and their rolls are the closest thing to perfect that I've had in AZ.  Also, they have pretty great happy hour specials and there is usually plenty of room in the bar for dining.  I recommend this place over and over again and I definitely would consider it number one for sushi in the valley.

N9NH5KuwWvw7Fh5MPD3tcg.text: Attempted to stop and get lunch and was told they were closed for lunch even though the hours listed said I had 10 minutes left.  I guess they didn't need my money even though my order would have been to go.  I will never attempt to dine here again.

38MwKHyq6i_PGqNOlTknDw.text: The only thing lousier than the food was the service.  The food came out warm and dry as if it had been sitting under the lamp for a while.  It was not gat tasting.  The sushi was nothing special.  The server was forgetful and unattentative.  She got the order wrong.  The only reason we did not complain is because the kids were tired and we were all hungry and did not want to wait for new food to be cooked or have to go some place else.  A waste of money for what you get.  You are better off with Hon Machi or Benihana!

76redIu9nj2M4K94nv3rpA.text: First time visitor on New Years Eve. Was pleasantly surprised at how good it was. Much better than some of the chain Japanese restaurants. Service was great and all the meals we had were excellent and reasonable price.  Had filet scallops and chicken as main entree. Side dishes excellent also. Our chef was friendly and entertaining. Will return soon.

cnUEUOSDXLchl2T08_AYvg.text: After reading mixed reviews, most of them looking disconcerting, ive had my reservations. But they were unfounded as I really had a good time and a good Valentine's day dinner. For those of you who took off stars cause the cook took too long to arrive with the  ingredients, keep in mind that they would have to find them, cut them, as well as grab the seasonings, cooking wines and oils, and utensils as soon as the order was given. Our cook was awesome, and food turned out great. Even though it may look like a tiny portion, it's not and they will ensure you will not leave hungry. Unlike benihana, the cooks squirt a shot or two of sake (rice wine they cook with) into your mouth, which mine did three times. Also they try to toss extra shrimp into your mouth, hint: keep an eye on it to catch it- they give you sake anyway even if you fail. Food was awesome (filet mignon and lobster tail, bf got steak and shrimp) and had me feeling stuffed less than halfway through the meal. Also was given a rose by our waiter after it. Very good service! I'd go again sometime.

kGmA1XIAJkh3ixOfSeVTpA.text: I do LOVE this place. It's not as expensive as teppan restaurants back home (California) and the food totally works for me. But let me break it down...  Service: I've never had a problem with the hosts, but sometimes the servers take a while. Now, mind you, this isn't EVERY time, just some of the time. But you don't come here if you're in a hurry, anyway...  Drinks/Food: I'm not 21, nor am I endowed with a "fake" ;),  so I can't say anything about the drinks. But the food...ahhh, so good. Portions are big, which is good for leftovers! Most dinner meals come with miso soup, steamed rice (which can be exchanged for fried at a slightly higher price), salad, and the entree itself. I think the sushi tastes great. I order the Buddha's Delight every time and I'm not disappointed, except...  -Sometime's the food's a bit greasy. Even the vegetables. Just tell the chef to go easy on the oil and butter. I know that people don't come here to eat the healthiest meals of all time, but still. -I am about 90% vegetarian and don't eat the meat. BUT! When I do try it, it always seems a tad undercooked. I try bits of steak, shrimp, or chicken (aka whatever my friends are having) almost every time I'm here, so yes, I have experience, and yes, it does taste a tad undercooked almost every time.  Price: The meals *average* about 25/person including tax, but not tip. Lunches are cheaper. The average I listed above is assuming you get the typical teppan meal, which most people do. Sushi and other appetizers aren't priced horribly, either. Your actual bill per person could be higher, but probably no more than 60 - there's lobster on the menu. I'd be very surprised if it was that much, though.  Decor/"feel": It's dark in here...not too lively. Somewhat interesting Japanese-style decor (well, duh) I don't really care, though. I come here to EAT!  Entertainment value: As a 20-year-old who's been to many different teppan restaurants HUNDREDS of times, I can say that this place is no different than any other. There are some cool chefs here, of course (I like Chris)...but unless you're a teppan n00b or a little kid you're not going to be enthralled. I will say it once again though: I personally do not care. I'm hungry.  OVERALL: Great place to eat, fun with a group, but make sure you talk to your chef and that you're not in a hurry. Awesome.

14l4xyAiqOP0sg4IlO3MqA.text: Still loving Kobe Steakhouse!  I been balancing the red meat with sushi bar dining every so often.  The sushi are consistently fresh and the sushi chefs been cranking out new items on the White Board. Tried the Spanish Mackeral sushi and Barracuda White Fish sashimi with fresh grated wasabi last Friday ($1 upcharge hooo.. worth the sinus clearing) Never thought I be putting Barracuda in my mouth. Yum!

XsIcQ7zYP9J6A0AaFOcf-Q.text: Ate here once before and it was fine, mediocre sushi at cheap happy hour prices. I went back today to try teppanyaki for my boyfriend's birthday since he loves teppanyaki. We went during lunch hour and called ahead and they said the tables close at 230pm. We get there at 200pm and they told us the tables were closed already. I was like fine whatever, We can just start ordering and then order off the happy hour at 3. So I get the chicken teriyaki lunch plate and it was disgusting. The chicken was severely over dry that I just couldn't eat it, and I'm not a picky eater at all. I basically just paid to eat a cup of rice and cold mushrooms that were also stir fried with the chicken. We told the waitress we also wanted to order off the happy hour menu and she ended up just bringing out our checks around 245. I mean, do they not care about making money lol? At that point I didn't think it was worth it to give them any more of my money so I went home and ate pizza instead.

rmI_kb6efsYHneIkORGW_A.text: Best Japanese steakhouse Ive ever been to! The chef's were extremely interactive and fun. I can't wait to come back. Ask for Jorge he's the best!

NPNolNUNMEyvp2jki14p5Q.text: I found this place searching yelp and read reviews for both listings: Kobe Japanese Steakhouse and Kobe Teppan and Sushi. We decided to try Kobe and were not disappointed. We went for teppan on a Tuesday evening and were seated quickly. There were not many people at the restaurant, and the staff was friendly. Our chef was an older man who was fun and entertaining. He interacted with everyone and performed the usual tricks. He definitely made this experience an unforgettable one. The food was delicious. I do wish they added more tofu to the miso soup, but that would be about the only suggestion. The seafood and filet were very flavorful. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone who loves seafood. I did not try the Kobe beef, but based on the quality of their other food I would imagine it would be very tasty. Of course this is in Tempe so anyone from the east or west coast might have a different opinion, but for seafood in Arizona it is great.

jFnokHU9TOGfMTbTKE1Jww.text: Connor is the best teppanyaki chef ever! The food and the whole experience was great. He has set the bar pretty high!

4cQSZ-cXOU0jMzEY79ZeXw.text: Occasionally, we will make the rounds at Teppan restaurants, and this time around; we opted to give this place a try. We're not neophytes at this, so we always arrive with some reservations.   From the moment we walked in, we were none too impressed with the greeting we received from the people whose job it is to welcome you with a smile. And make your first impression a memorable one. It was memorable alright - in a negative way! The greeting was cold and disinterested. Yes, there are two of us! We are sorry that we interrupted whatever you were doing to let you know that customers actually want to dine here this particularly evening - NOT!  After being seated with another party, we were quite impressed with the cheerfulness and attentiveness of our server. She was very prompt and courteous as well. She actually did a great job of livening up the mood to get us ready for our Teppan chef.  Enlivened, he was not. Our chef was dry and reserved. Either he was having an off day, a bad day, or this is his typical demeanor. Definitely not the kind of presentation we were expecting.  And to top it all off, the food wasn't that impressive either. The chicken was definitely undercooked, and so were the vegetables. The rice was passable. The only redeeming quality was my wife's Kobe Beef steak. She indicated that it was done to her liking.  And as we were leaving, we passed by reception booth, and received the same cold shoulder we got when we first arrived. It's no surprise that this place was more than 1/2 empty on a Friday evening. Hopefully, they can endeavor to rectify these deficiencies.

zm2HXH7Egp9F7rzrTynQoQ.text: The place is a rock star.  The service was great and the cook was amazing.  We had sushi as well as having our Teppan at the the table.  The quality and taste along with the price was great.  Would recommend if in the area.  They get very busy, I would call ahead and make a reservation.

ENGnpF-2W2gxrKpEfjl0Ww.text: Kobe is a great place to go with family or friends. Lot of options for seating- teppan where they make the food in front of you, normal seating at a table or booth, or high top seating at the bar.   They have a really solid happy hour for drinks and rolls which is usually what draws me in. They have the usual rolls but also some specialty rolls that are really amazing. The yum yum roll is my fav- served with special sauces drizzled on top and served warm. Sooooo good. Something I never pass up on is the ginger salad too- it's really small and a great appetizer but there's something real special about that ginger dressing on top.   ALSO, some of the best chicken fried rice ever. You can order small and large sizes and it's made to order so you can order without certain ingredients (i always skip on the onions).

26JAVHXN0tCsbbxVJ5jcCA.text: I came on the late night. The place divided by 3 sections; a wine beer bar, a sushi bar, and a dining room for families. The whole environment was great, calm, and that was what I need that day.   The services were average, which mean I did wait for little bit minutes even I saw not many of people there but still considered ok :).   The sushi was great one, they have sea urchin and unagi that were great. The miso flavor was nice with enough amount in a small bowl.  Ok, the only minus was, this sushi chef (there was two people behind the bar), they nonstop talked, chatted, and I had to listen (and waited for my sushi) this guy talked even until I am done eating.   Overall, love this hidden place, I will come over to try something else, and YES, I would love to recommended this place.

i9NZadMkoaAl9s1uFCJgSA.text: The food was good and the chef was fun, but the wait for a seat was ridiculous. We arrived just after 5pm to an empty restaurant, and weren't seated for at least 30 minutes when another couple finally arrived. (I guess they don't want to start a teppan table for just two people.) Once seated, and after our drink order was finally taken, another party of four were swiftly seated and rushed to place their drink order. (They literally hadn't even been given a menu yet.) For some reason, while we were first to arrive we were the very last to be served at our table. We finally made it out of there around 730. No dessert, nothing fancy, just a two hour wait for actual sustenance, unless salty soup and iceberg lettuce is going to keep you sated.... dont come here hungry.

jQGoErflHbobw-IcoTb9aQ.text: Came here with my co-workers, what a great time and sooo much food. Our chef was very funny and entertaining. This was a great place

fQO9wg1zPEf90M2qNsftvA.text: This place awful. Had high hopes and was truly disappointed. We waited 20+ minutes to get a menu. Food was mediocre at best. Service was lacking. The restaurant was big and nice inside. I think maybe they should limit their large menu so they can concentrate on quality instead of quantity. Took some pics but I jus couldn't make the food look good no matter what filter I used. Lol. Do not order the noodles

25c0Xo6XjRQu89swILyrjA.text: Horrible policy where they can't seat you unless your whole party's there.... even if you're one of 12 and only waiting on a couple more people.  Hostess and host were rude and incompetent.  They lost a party of 15 cuz they refused to seat us and at least give us some water while we wait for the rest of the guests. So stupid... way to lose business! If you're looking for a good Teppan please just drive a couple more miles to SAKANA where there is good food & good service!!!! Never coming back here

JQA17_plmZ8Vjd52nqhVNQ.text: Still find this place comfortable, like home. It is not super busy, and they rarely have enough servers, so you have to be patient and know that you're going to get yummy sushi and some adult beverages that are reasonably priced. The crowd is full of different sorts of people, and that makes it interesting and fun. Still need to change happy hour menu.  Coming back!!  As it goes on..... tonight poor service and we were the only ones around. Food good and fresh. Still like it.

6Xjj5ofTVG_Ksk9WqiL-gA.text: We tried this restaurant for the first time on a Saturday night. I called to make a reservation prior to our dinner and found the person on the phone to be quite unenthusiastic. I like to keep an open mind, so I hoped we would have a better greeting once we arrived. However, we received the same mildly friendly welcome when we arrived at the restaurant. The food was delicious, and the dining experience was enjoyable. The reason I'm giving this place three stars is the lack of enthusiasm of the staff,  everyone seemed to have a melancholic mood.

n0f1Z4kCr9ttnjUMMWpfSw.text: The best all you can eat sushi menu I've had in a long time.  It's Monday thru Thursday from 5 to 7 . The service was great and the food was really good. We tried a little bit of everything and you can share if everyone does the all you can eat.

rBdTA8fVNP4xk4tHEdbnhg.text: Went to Kobe for dinner yesterday and ordered the Kobe Beef and Scallops. The description on the menu sounded like Kobe beef but what I was served certainly didn't look/taste anything like what I was expecting. Kobe beef is supposed to be more tender than a filet. It is supposed to be marbled with fat throughout and almost melt in your mouth when you chew. What I was served didn't look like Kobe beef and it was tougher than the filet my partner was served. The meal was also $4 more than expected because their online menu had it priced $4 cheaper than the in-store menu.  Overall, I was disappointed with the experience but will say that the drink specials, appetizers, (my partners) filet and scallops were great.

NEln7JGneOWywDBwokkJTA.text: We good my grand daughter her for her birthday and was really a good time. The chef was good and cooked the steak to perfection.

RyfedmCznywlKGwuucpqjg.text: Great experience ever!! Everyone was super friendly! Saki bombs were delicious! Food was presentable and tasteful! Can't wait to go back again!

1v_dvv7gK_VZTbuHHhn4Hg.text: I always come here any time we have a celebration. Been doing it for the last 10 yrs and always great. The chefs are well experienced, been doing their art for years.  I highly recommend Kobe's

dy5bnZCfHt7xalSO5odL8w.text: This is my first review I have left anywhere, I felt it was necessary to share our experience. My boyfriend and I decided to try this teppanyaki as it is close to our home, we usually goto Osaka however wanted to try something closer. This was the worst teppanyaki experience we have ever had. The teppanyaki chef was absolutely terrible. Incompetent, lackadaisical, and truly awful. We just went for a casual date night that turned into a nightmare. We ordered filet mignon for our main course to share which comes with rice, salad, soup etc. The rice and meat were under cooked and lacked any flavor at all amongst many other issues encountered throughout the dinner (i.e chef spraying saki all over my boyfriends face) The only reason I give two stars is because the bartender and server were fabulous. Our meal (we still paid for drinks & sushi) were comped which was also nice considering the terrible experience. The server was a great sport about the whole experience. We ended up down the road at the Vine!

s63p_Qq6jW83mLpriqjOlQ.text: Friendly staff. Fair prices. We had sushi rolls, sashimi, gyoza, and tempura: everything was good, most was great. The only down side was that one of us got his food first and was finished by the time everyone else was served.

j5lsX43_dfWM6DcUpUokUA.text: We went there for xmas eve dinner hoping to start a new yearly tradition for xmas dinner here.  Lets just say we will be finding a new place for xmas eve dinner.  We made reservations for 7 snd got a table for 6 and had to squeeze the 7th person in.  The service was very poor, sat with unfilled glasses for a long time and they never brought out our  white rice out until after we finished our dinner.  The cook was not very entertaining and actually kinda rude with his comments.  He obviously must have been new because he cooked everything separate batches and my daughters dinner came afer almost everyone was finished with there meal.   And worst of all we were forced to pay over 30$ tip for crapy service .  Never again!

OJ6a1lpi89XmBSGfzCrVrw.text: My GF and I go to Kobe maybe 2-3 times per month.   On occasion, we'll take the kids with us, kids being defined as early-twenties.   First let me say they have a solid happy hour.  Great prices on a number of sushi items and drinks as well.   The food is generally quite good, and the drinks are excellent.  We have always had excellent service in the bar and the BTs are great.  Generally fresh and tasty sushi/sashimi.  The miso soup is above average, albeit not spectacular.  As to the teppanyaki tables, the shows have always been solid.  Pretty decent slicing and dicing; along with a fire show of sorts.   The anglo chef is the best, in my opinion.  Forgot his name since we do not go the "table" route very often.   As to the food quality at the table, not bad.  The shrimp and calamari have consistently been fresh and tasty; couple times I'd say "not so much" as to the steak.  This said, I could not give them a bad rating on any of the food items, either.   Service quality has always been excellent in the bar, sometimes a tad slow if you are at a "table" for teppanyaki.   All in all, we are fairly satistfied customers and Kobe is one of the better sushi locations in South Tempe.

wV9ydhoeJU_pmA10ZyuAGg.text: Tasty food and quick service with reservations yesterday-Friday night, a busy evening.  We happened to get a great server who was friendly and efficient!  So much that I paid the compliment to the management.  From the other Yelp reviews, it sounds like the service is hit or miss....I must have lucked out this time!

nEJxlOai8uBSonEdkJWu5w.text: Made a mother's day reservation same day, and staff served me no problem, even though I had to change the # in my party. We arrived and were seated and served promptly. We love this place because Chef Taylor is so fun, passionate, and makes the food perfect every time. After our first experience with Taylor, we now request him every time (do it!) and have become regulars for birthdays and mother's days.  His scallops are the best I've had in my life, but the meat, vegetables, and shrimp are always incredible.  He's always telling jokes, engaging the kids, and aims to please (he chops extra garlic for my dishes upon request, and looks out to offer extra sake to those who want it)!  At the end of dinner my mom and myself were given roses for mother's day!  I drive out from North Phoenix to come here for family dinners. It's a treat and well worth taking the time/ drive out to experience!

iyN3qBb_BeYpT0ncZtOM-g.text: Awesome Teriyaki Chicken Bento Box... definitely more than enough food in that thing. Green Iced tea was amazing as well. Not too expensive, great service.

ShoiePCm8xG2onGxPLRg-g.text: We have been here a  handful of times and yesterday was our last.   We got there for an early dinner at about 510.  They asked if we wouldn't mind waiting for 20 minutes.  I asked what the other option was and the hostess said there was not one.  So we waited the 20 minutes, plus another 10 and they said they were just waiting for the other party to show up.  We decided to leave and go elsewhere.  As we got up and said we were leaving, she said we can seat you.  Sure you can "seat me" but I probably won't be eating for another hour.  Horrible service!  No one offered me a drink or apologized.  The parking lot was pretty empty and there were so many employees there.   I will be going elsewhere when I want Teppan.

0a07sWinq3_EmBsFzKjOwQ.text: Very great restaurant. A nice moment we shared there. Food and animations were cool

M_K0FtS0XE4cMo80GIswAg.text: I've been using this restaurant for every birthday and graduation for the last three or four years! My family and I love this place the food is simple and delicious. Amazing sushi and the teppan is a great show and kid friendly. Ask for Allen he's the best!

Qoml3EaFiZRPor4KFnsoEQ.text: My family frequents here a lot and we have always had great service with a clean environment. Happy hour prices are great and the sushi is always fresh. While traveling to other states we have had a very difficult time finding a fresher sushi experience.  The grill on the weekend seems to always be on the loud side but It's only because of the entertainment that the chefs have created for the guests. All in all the only down side is the possibility of having to wait for a table when it's busy.  It's a great place for a first date or a 50th anniversary.

_E9idQM648Z8vRgj2P50qw.text: I was impressed with the happy hour and it goes until 8pm!!!!  The vegetarian sushi rolls were all yummy and very fresh looking/tasting.  Drank lots of sake.  We will be back!

xdt3Qs3uKfqrmCeT3I6OWw.text: Went here with some friends after an ASU Graduation Ceremony and it was dead. Service was alright and our chef was nice but wasn't very engaging. The chicken fried rice was the best I have ever had from a teppenyaki style restaurant. The steak on the other hand was not cooked to liking.

lLmY39hU6ct52wi4_9kCzg.text: Checked the website to make a reservation and there's nothing on it about reservations. Walk in and turns out they only do thing via telephone. Wtf who hasn't moved into 1990's yet and started accepting electronic reservations.

ycKWQKQLtQ_uK2pqkrn9RA.text: The kobe steak was reasonably priced and came with a lot of sides. I did not think it was up to par with the reputation kobe steaks have. They also served my wife tempura with a mosquito fried in it. They brought us another one and gave us a free soup and salad. Other than that this place isn't too bad but we would not come back here.

Sg6pQduhugG7DDSOlCd8Sw.text: Kobe has a wide variety of items available on their lunch menu.  Always priced right, and always prepared fresh in front of you.  Kind of tough to beat that.  I have yet to have a bad experience at Kobe.

sbuRFGHpoHdpwGI3_qmK5Q.text: I've been meaning to review our experience for a couple of months and here it is.   We bought a TravelZoo Local Deal for the $25 Theater-Style Teppanyaki or Sushi Dinner for 2 at Kobe (Chandler, AZ). It was plain awful. They completely bait and switched on us and treated us like second rate customers.   What began as either sushi or teppanyaki to the tune of $75 (we opted for sushi) turned into a fixe prix three course menu with extremely limited choices, none of which added up to the said dollar value. Not only that, but they sanctioned off a separate room for travelzoo local deal diners. A dirty room with no music, a new waitress-in-training who didn't speak english, a supervising waiter who apologized for the obvious bait and switch, stating the owners wanted to make it "simpler and more organized" when clearly they were trying to save a dime.  After we showed our surprise to the unexpected change, we had very little attention or service for the rest of the night. We had to basically beg to get the bill so we could leave. The food honestly wasn't even good, some was just plain inedible.   It was a depressing experience and I suggested that travelzoo never partner with that particular restaurant again. I also suggest that you find another more palatable place to dine. Plenty of other choices in town, no need to see for yourself here.

-WUv04zJ4-1EzVQgBNlYhA.text: I go for Rotary on Monday afternoons.  The service we receive is FANTASTIC, however the food is marginal.  We have a set menu so I can't comment on everything, but sometimes the sushi doesn't seem completely fresh and everything else is just sort of bland.  Oh, and there always seems to be a strange smell when you walk into the restaurant.  Not sure what that is

LYesbyRpj2fiEd8ZJKiBlQ.text: Happy Hour Review...  We stopped in to check out the happy hour. The HH menu is very limited. We decided to skip the weak food options and just have the $2 sake. For cheap sake it was not too bad.  The decor is nice and the staff were all dresses in kimono type dresses.   I would come back to try the teppan.

bdrKhkPBM8m8ssrZ0M6ZNw.text: I love me some raw fish and rice, but the sushi at this place really left a bad taste in my mouth.  Literally.  It's because their rice tasted kind of plastic for some reason, and it overshadowed the taste of the sushi.    plastic rice = bad sushi.

oRC7nXpaa4P06hSrFwtPqQ.text: Cook was great like last time. Kids loved the fire, the fish, and the food. The service was friendly, but mostly absent, even though we were one of the the only ones there at lunch. Maybe because the gratuity was already baked into our bill? I took the whole fam, and with 6 people or more, they add 18% for a tip.

69obG30otJn25RWOBwnLJg.text: We ate here in December and everything tasted old. Finally decided to try it again and that was a mistake. We were seated immediately however it took 10 minutes for a server to even come over. And we had to flag her down. So we finally ordered. 50 minutes later after still not receiving our sushi we decided just to pay for our drinks and leave. Never returning. No reason to. Better sushi around town. Ra and Sakana. We ended going to Sakana and eating and leaving in under 45 minutes.

jxSyFsI6IkZVaMmxWxjQHw.text: Service is horrible. We were actually asked by hostesses how many menus we had to have because they were really going to be busy. They over -seated our table even though we made reservations four hours before. The restaurant was dirty and reeked of cigarette smoke and alcohol upon entering. We were then told after trying to squish in that we could move further down to sit next to another party. Behind the cook literally  joining another table. We asked to be sat where we could sit together and see and we were told to deal with it. Have no idea how food is as we left due to horrible service and lack of cleanliness.

LccXxx7DjK33pdA7NsE7lg.text: 3.75*   Had our holiday party here.  It was fun and a different version of the 'Benihana' schpeil. Here comes the asian ketchup...beating heart fried rice, shrimp tail in hat....Here, there's a little less skill at the table, but much more FIRE...and Alcohol...our chef would sporadically say SAKE SAKE! and try to squirt sake from a small squeeze bottle in everyone's mouth from a distance. Not all ended up in your mouth unfortunately.  No one wanted to get pulled over reeking of sake, so most opted out. Definitely fun to watch though! Food was better than I expected. Everything tasted fresh and had decent flavors.  The interior of the restaurant isn't as nice as a Benihana, or Sapporo, but at least the price reflects that. It is fun and believe it or not, maybe a little less cheesy than Benihana.   Great for groups!

2QTto3sxGPYdTKUg6_Qdzw.text: How fun! Meal starts off with miso soup, then salad with a funky dressing, appetizer shrimp, fried rice, then the main course. Somewhere in the middle of it all, the chef tries to flip shrimp into your mouth. Not so successful at our table, but entertaining nonetheless!  Variety of scallops, steak, lobster tail, chicken, veggies, and tofu.  Everyone was happy with their meal, portions are large, and drinks are tasty! Definitely bring some $$, because it's not cheap.

Y2XzcdpMRJslMwpYOYLOAw.text: Been back a few times for sushi but today I arrived to try the regular lunch menu. I arrived at 11:50 on a Tuesday and I was the only customer.   I noticed the music was a bit louder in the dining area, as opposed to the sushi bar. With Adele-like music playing, it wasn't obtrusive.   I got the chicken katsu and an iced tea for $11.89 plus tip.   After five mins I got my tea and miso soup. The soup was your classic miso, with tofu and seaweed plus a few shavings of scallion. Good flavor there but the seaweed was slightly over bitter.   Next came the entree, about 5 mins later.  The chicken was nicely and thoroughly breaded and then fried. It came on a bed of green and purple cabbage. If I had some vinegar sauce, it would've served a purpose other than decoration. The meal also came with a small bowl of white rice.   Still working my way thru the menu, so that's it for now.   Update: I've been back too many times to count. I've stuck with the sushi bar and have had great experiences each time. Fast, pleasant service, fresh sushi and good lunch prices. Msn really takes care of his customers and I highly recommend you visit the sushi bar to find out for yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of Kobe Teppan & Sushi - Tempe, AZ, United States. The lunch sushi menu. I recommend the Sunshine Roll. Good textures and flavors.

rZbcbWTcp-Poos3fxp5zWA.text: Good alternative to Benihana's.  We've now been here a couple times, deviating from our regular spot - Benihana. Their menu selection is solid, with similar offerings as the aforementioned competitor. In our two trips we've ordered the hibachi meals, yakisoba, some rainbow rolls and gyoza. The food is really good and if only rating this restaurant by that criteria, I'd likely give it a 4.5 stars. However, something we noticed on our last visit was the lack of energy in the restaurant. You'd expect a teppanyaki restaurant to be loud and full of commotion as the chefs prepare everyone's food, but this was not the case. For me that's all part of the experience. Also, the most recent chef we had was not very entertaining or engaging with the patrons. For that reason, I've rated this restaurant as 4 stars. Still not a bad rating, but could be a 5 if they turn it up and improve the buzz in the room. I'd like to add that a coupon is regularly sent in the mail for $20 after spending $100, which with a family of four is like having the tip paid for. We'd probably go again, but next time we're going to Benihana - per the request from the kids.

WBI8nitpAQm2t3SbcCGVpQ.text: Always great food, very courteous and excellent and fresh sushi, we love this place and come at least once a month. One of the best places in town!

Ilfx6VSGkwgX0nChf3ua3w.text: We always have awesome experience food very delicious. Chef Jorge and Jerry are highly recommended fun and entertaining!!

photos.caption: Photo of Kobe Teppan & Sushi - Tempe, AZ, United States. Shrimp Tempura Roll

The only reason I left off a star was because of the lack of personality of the chef; I've been to other hibachi grills that are far more entertaining. Also, I typically get a honey butter for the fried rice at another hibachi grill that we frequent that really takes it up a notch and there wasn't this option available here. We wouldn't definitely visit again though! I especially want to try their all you can eat sushi (as soon as I'm no longer pregnant and can enjoy the raw options)!

He was very fun, engaging and the food was crazy yummy. This is my 1st visit. I will make this my new Teppan & Sushi spot!

Not sure why, because usually this kind of food tastes the same regardless where you go. Don't think I'll give them another chance. Might go to the basic Benihana.

One of them looked like they weren't even wearing pants, super unprofessional and almost lost my appetite.   They said it would be a 15 min wait, and after 45 minutes, we asked the hostesses when we were going to get seated. It's almost as if they too embarrassed to admit that they messed up and forgot about us, or just didn't care about us. Complete waste of time and won't be coming back ever.

pfn4UoxmyEcsxSO9HmKZJQ.text: Saturday night dinner for a friends birthday. Party of 23! I wasn't expecting stellar service because taking care of a large boisterous group of drinkers is never easy!  Kyle was literally the best teppanyaki Master ever!!! Super fun!!! Great sashimi lobster, scallops, shrimp even the vegetables were fantastic! Beautiful restaurant great service.  Happy hour even on a Saturday.  So excited to visit the sushi bar on a date!

fdeIVAjx6fZ88uhVs0s1Og.text: Where to start....where to start... Our reservation was for 6:30pm, party of 13 Our entire party arrived by 6:45 Seated by 7 Party that arrived After us sat and began eating during this hour... the chef arrived to the table After 8pm. He Had an open argument/disagreement with our server and then walked away because the order was "written wrong".   I don't know if there are enough words for this experience to write at this moment, so feel free to ask questions.  Yes, I spoke to the manager. It was obvious that he didn't know how to handle this situation. Yes he apologized to me, unfortunately never came to the table to apologize to the rest of the group nor did he offer them anything. He explained that it takes time to prepare for large parties and the order was written in the wrong order so the chef had to go back and prepare it again......... I can't say that this makes any sense since there weren't any additional ingredients needed. At this point everyone's mood was down. Think about it, you tell your party dinner at 6:30 so people bring their appetites. Yes there is soup brought out, but not everyone wants miso soup. Yes they bring a salad out, but not everyone wants a salad. So imagine waiting from 7 until after 8:15/8:30 for your order to be cooked. The manager comped my husbands dinner only (This was his bday dinner) and then left the restaurant. When there was an issue with closing the tabs (because he had comped the wrong dinner) he was no where to be found.   The rest of the staff was understanding and helpful with what they could do, but the manager and chef could have done better. What a mess. No social skills for this type of industry.  We enjoyed visiting this location for Our special occasions until now, can't say we'll be back much less recommend it. I'm not sure what happened to the prior management, but they're missed.

4Lf8D_Dn92w5Gi0akMG5pg.text: My girlfriend and I went on a date here a couple of days ago and really enjoyed the service and food. The server was extremely polite and as was the chef. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for great food with fair prices.

GYz43jojZLjczpBpFBsVNw.text: I would not recommend this place. We arrived party of 2 and there were 2 couples waiting ahead of us. Instead of taking us all back to the Teppan table together (which is where we all ended up) the hostess proceeded to tell us all individually it would be a few minutes and made all of us wait. Pointless.   Once seated we order an appetizer and it never came but later still charged on our bill. The chef was not very engaging at all as we observed other tables have shrimp tossed in their mouth and that was not the case for our table. The chef asked questions about our food order/preference and did not honor our request. For example, he asked how I would like my steak cooked? I advised medium and he proceeded to cook it well done with the other order on the grill. I asked for the fat from the steak be kept on plate and it proceeded to throw it away. He prepared the shrimp and placed my food on another persons plate. To everyone at the table it just appeared he was just trying to hurry up and go home for the night and could care less about getting our orders right.   The waiter was like Flash lightening bolt and I can only remember him quickly removing our salad and soup bowls but cannot recall him asking how things were going let alone if we needed anything. Even when he brought our bill before we could get a word out he had ran away to the back. Food wasn't great and service was poor. Don't recommend this place. I'll stick to Benihana's.

harzfA4YM7NvqqrSYyWOWg.text: Allow me to apologize in advance for the following novella.  Sorry, not sorry.  Kobe is by far my absolute favorite place in AZ to eat. While the food is amazing, it wouldn't hurt for them to make a few well-needed changes. Let me start by saying they have the biggest and best shrimp, mouth-watering filet, and the most bomb swordfish I have ever had. The soup is AMAZING--and I find tofu to be repellant but in the soup--perfection. Regardless of which entree you decide on, you will get more than enough food. If someone at your table happens to order shrimp, they will bring extra and give everyone at the table shrimp as well. I've been to Kobe probably 25 times, and without a doubt the chef's know what they are doing and I haven't seen any slip ups with the utensil tricks and/or fire. On point with the entertainment (some better than others but all great, nonetheless). My favorite cook there is a white kid (the minority, what a surprise amirite?) and want to say his name is Kyle. He's super professional, generous with the Sake shots while cooking, and never seems to have a bad day even when under obvious stress by the chefs being understaffed. That was the problem on our most recent visit this past weekend. Usually when they bring you the yummy tofu and spinach soup () and salad, the cook arrives at the table soon after. Unfortunately, our full table had to wait for OVER an hour, probably closer to 2 hours for a chef. My friend Tyler and I had time to drink probably too many Sake Bombers (the waitress brought us very dirty glasses with them-ughhh--I had to get up and exchange them for CLEAN glasses at the sushi bar), soup, salad, and even ordered, waited on and consumed 4 different types of sushi..I recommend the Rainbow Rolls btw- delicious!! The Las Vegas Rolls are gnarly, but that's just my personal opinion. Eel sauce is Ipecac. Also, shouldn't water come to all customers automatically? If you want water you have to order it. I just find it weird considering we are in AZ-- water should be a default move for any dine in restaurant. We waited for so long it was ridiculous. Even though the waitress had good intentions, she annoyingly came over countless times to apologize for the wait (stop apologizing lady...we get it--we are drunk and hungry, where is the food??) She asked probably 5 times and tried to take my soup and salad even though I kept telling her "no don't take it yet" I was eating slow to not fill up. Grrrrr....this was a Friday night, so needless to say it was packed with only one or two chefs at most for the ENTIRE place. The last thing I'll whine and cry like a bitch about is the waitress looked annoyed when I apparently had the audacity to ask her to box our leftovers. Because of her, I now believe that I can audibly hear people rolling their eyes. This place is the exception to the whole "service trumps the food" thing. It gets 4 stars because they could probably punch me in the jaw and I'd still come back...it's THAT good. But seriously Kobe, in regards to the shortage of chefs, please have some on standby or a backup plan. Doesn't matter, I'll still go back.

LXDyzyVepF75Ln3rjfFJSw.text: Have been a few times and always get lucky enough to have the same tappan chef. I can't recall his name but he is an older chef that has been there for years. He is a great personality and always makes his tables have a good time. Not to mention the food is always delicious!! The filets will melt in your mouth. We have never had the sushi, but that side of the restaurant is always full!! Unlike a chain Benihana, the food is always fantastic!!

tk0dOCMvR0i3egGHjVVbQA.text: I hate to let people in on this fantastic hidden gem. Their happy hour is ridic. $3.50 gets you your choice of a Cali roll,  crunchy Cali roll, or spicy tuna roll. Six bucks for a las Vegas roll too! My husband went with the six dollar sake bomb with the big beer! Check it out sometime.

vFXwY79Ghs-HFd8bS0dK1A.text: I came here with a group of friends on a saturday night for one of our dear friends birthday. The staff was nice and our chef Jose was entertaining. He took time to ensure that our group was having fun. I ordered ordered the new York steak which was tender and cooked to medium rare as requested. I would definitely come back for the food and Jose's cooking.

YG3sir6JueQLr_RIi-32-g.text: Jorge was fantastic he elevated our dining experience and made it memorable. My friends and I are from California and return each year just for him. He is great and deserves the best here! Come ask for him!

When we walked in, we were greeted with the typical Teppanyaki smell, which I guess should be expected in a Japanese steak house, but it is still gross.  We were seated immediately at 7 on a Friday night and promptly served, which is good because the food was not worth waiting for.  The sushi was mediocre and the teriyaki was drenched in sauce instead of tastefully seasoned.  Everything we ordered was completely eatable, but not good enough for the price.  This restaurant would get 4 stars if it were cheaper.
