Zfj-vIRflOuXBsf07hsmWQ.text: Went here for my birthday with a group of friends. The food was good, however the service was probably the WORST I've ever experienced. I had made a reservation in advance, so they were perfectly aware of the large party. Not to mention, there was ONLY one other table in the entire restaurant eating.   We saw our server maybe once, possibly twice when she asked for our drinks and then brought us our check. We all had empty drinks for probably 20-30 minutes. I was disappointed because I had brought so many close friends and family here, in hopes of having a fun dinner.   I truly am never one to complain and always give the benefit of the doubt (I use to serve) but this was awful. Not to mention extremely overpriced.  Overall all, don't go here!!

5NwpCxNKSrtvNBjJVF2d2Q.text: Definitely a great value place for sushi. Entrees are decent, but not extraordinary. Friendly servers.

s1deGqw5M9G_GfwyhFXeaQ.text: Do they really want me here?  So my husband and I stopped here one evening approximately 45 minutes before they closed, as soon as we came thru the door they made sure we knew they closed in 45 minutes. Ummm...Okay, I get it, but you're still open, right? Our server was also insistent that we knew what time they closed, he actually rounded it down from the 30 seconds it took to seat us, to them closing in 30 minutes now. So, while our server practically holding the menu in front of our faces, we managed to rattle off some choices. He promptly returned with our drinks and he then asked if he thought at that time we would want more drinks, before we finished our first round he brought the other drinks we thought we should order just in case we missed our opportunity later. Our food came out all at appetizer, salads, soup, sushi, and entrees! Once I poured some soy sauce for myself our server came by and asked if I would need more because he's trying to clear his tables now, gathering all the soy sauces on each table to assuredly refill them as his required "side work". He offered us to go boxes before we had even had finished our salads. We obliged feeling very rushed we thought the atmosphere at home would be more enjoyable. So,while boxing up our own food the rest of the wait staff essentially carried us to our car. The only reason this is getting 3 stars is because the food is really, really, good. BUT for real this service is beyond a joke.

9fGnx-7eSINrKu_RArrkdA.text: Came here tonight to eat dinner, and WOW! amazing services. The food was superb, always  amazing. I will be coming back shortly and I can't. Their, SUPREME CALIFORNIA ROLL OMG so good if you never had you must try. Along with their UP TOWN ROLL....I'm drooling right now thinking about my dinner.  A Must Try

cynzU8ys63Pe21TGj7TobQ.text: The sushi smelled and tasted fishy. But we went mid week at three so its posable the fish was a bit old. We are planning on trying it again to see if the sushi gets better. The place was great and the staff is nice

HRWSUElgZiwDEgnNwg4OzA.text: Sushi is good, lunch service is really slow, almost became my own server saw my food waiting on a counter. Seems nice but dirty plates on the tables.

6R8Q21YOFx1aiCKMh4aRNQ.text: I'm highly upset with Kobe. It's a place my coworkers and I stop at when we are in the mood for sushi. I waited 20 + minutes for Las Vegas rolls and Crunchy California Rolls. We called the order for pick up 15 minutes before we got there. I personally do not feel like their sushi is quality enough to be waiting 40 minutes for mediocre sushi. And there were no cars in the parking lot. What could they be doing smh. Hope this helps!

MQvbPwwhGdD91HKqORF7aw.text: The food is amazing and I love the sake shots, but when you make a reservation for 7:30 and at 8 pm you're still sitting at table with no food.....kind of disappointing. The hostess' were less than helpful, and had very poor customer service.

vgcLygNy7-XlfGyxlS-4Tw.text: The endless sushi menu is awesome and has made Kobe our favorite night out/special occasion destination. The menu includes select appetizers, mini-entrees, salads, soups, specialty rolls, hand rolls and nigiri. And it's literally all you care to eat, just be sure to pace your ordering since there is a small surcharge for uneaten pieces (that you are welcome to take home). It's fun with a group, and there are sufficient non-sushi/raw fish options for people who aren't feeling adventurous. We took my parents when they visited, and my mom was extremely satisfied with the gyoza, teriyaki chicken and salads. Be sure to try the tempura fried mushrooms ... WOW!!! If you're going to order more than one specialty roll, this option definitely pays for itself, just keep in mind it isn't offered on Friday or Saturday evening. Happy Hour at the bar has some excellent drink specials, and always friendly staff.

Aseou3WHIzibwR9XCJmT2g.text: The chef was entertaining so that was a positive. It is entertaining for kids and there is a kids menu ($12-16) with beef, chicken, and shrimp. So pretty good for kids. They also shoot sake into your mouth before cooking, also entertaining. The food was pretty standard for a teppanyaki place. Overall for the serving size, it was expensive about $20-35 for each dinner. They also have the Kobe beef which will run $40-70 for each dinner.  I think it is good for special occasions but one dinner is not enough food for people with above average appetites. Therefore to not leave hungry, you would need an appetizer, drink, plus the dinner which includes rice, small salad. Possibly also side orders. That could put the price over $50/person which is a little more than what I prefer to get a good meal.

BpKABcw9nto2k5yM59ti4w.text: Definitely not the best teppan I've ever had. First time we Wen on a Thursday and it was totally dead. Got sat at a table with a couple with 3 kids and a baby. Because babies should be around flaming stoves.  Anyway, the chef was not Japanese, which always seems awkward since they act Japanese and make jokes about Japan. Although he didn't do much joke making, and seemed out of his element.   The menu did not include any tuna. The steak and shrimp was okay at best. The shrimp seemed under cooked.  I come here because I'm a sucker for teppan, and because it's close. If it was farther away, I probably wouldn't go.

oRjrG91remHZH31JJwsGrA.text: I took my fiance and some friends here for her birthday, and we all had an AMAZING time!  First of all, Happy Hour is great.  $6 for a bottle of Sake and a Beer.  If you like Sake Bombs, this is a terrific deal.  They have good food specials on Happy Hour too.  The service was great.  Our Teppan chef was a ton of fun, and as an added perk, he had a bottle of Sake that he routinely sprayed into our mouths.  Delicious.  The food was very good.  Like most Teppan restaurants, it's a little expensive, but in my opinion you're paying for the entertainment as well, which makes it all worth it.  The next time we're looking for Teppan, we're coming back to Kobe for sure.

tTOKm9rljsld-MzLGqap-w.text: The food was amazing!!!! Sushi was delicious, drinks were delicious, and Teppan was delicious! The service was great. We had Taylor for the grill top and he was great! Had to wait awhile is why I didn't give it 5 stars... But other than that I will become a regular!

09U5Fz6Z05s_1UzRvgJPOA.text: I had gift certificates to this place and wanted to eat healthier so it was decided that my wife, Kathy R., my grandson and I would head here for lunch.   My wife got the Kobe steak & lobster, Kathy R. got the kobe steak, my grandson got the kobe steak and lobster and I had the kobe steak.  All the meals come with: Miso soup, salad, choice of white or chicken fried rice and grilled veggies. When you go to a teppenyaki restaurant, you don't really go for the food, you kind of go for the entertainment. but this place served Kobe beef. Kobe beef is known for being lean, lower in cholesterol than chicken or turkey. it is known as  Healthy beef? In fact all of us  commented that the steak was so succulent it melted in your mouth.  Kobe has community seating...(The tables are designed to fit 8 people) You are seated next to other parties around the chef and the chef comes by after all orders are taken. Then in addition the chef brings all fresh ingredients to the table and cooks it for you on the spot with various tricks! The show is very impressive.  The "show" is the checf who cooks in front of you.  In this case he also pulled tricks with knives and fire to keep us all entertained.  My steak was cooked perfectly and melted in my mouth. There is nothing like Kobe Steak. The Miso soup was excellent, the salad was so so,  the grilled veggies were ok. It also came with white rice which I did not eat. I only had a few bites of everything and took a lot home with me for later.    One last thing about the meal sevral people at our table ordered fried rice so  we were given the opportunity to try some since the chef made extra. I must say even though I only had a bite OMG it was good. It had to be the best fried rice I've had in many years.   FOOD:  If you rate the place strictly on food, then it's not that spectacular. But you're not here solely for food. You come here for an experience. PRICE: The prices are reasonable. SERVICE: After we got seated the waitress immediately gave us menus and asked us for our drinks/orders. She was welcoming, and  was always right there when we needed her to be. She was simply excellent,  efficient, and friendly.  AMBIENCE:  Overall I enjoyed the restaurants environment and vibe! Perfect for families and group celebrations! It's pricey but you gotta keep in mind you're also paying for the entertainment and its unique service. CONCLUSION: This restaurant is fun for birthdays, Anniversaries, special occassions, group outings, couples, and kids. It's entertaining and the food tastes great.   RETURN FACTOR: 100% will definitely be back here but only for a special occassion..

S8W-UifI-1pr7I2WJ1gjTw.text: Taylor was our cook for the tepan grill. He was awesome, fun and most importantly cooked the food to perfection. We have been to many tepan grills and hands down this is the best so far!!! Place is nice and service was good. Will def be back for more!!!   Can't forget to add that the shrimp were amazing. Plump and juicy!!!

nX3PHJCD5_p49PN0LdO9rA.text: I like this place! Been coming here for years. Chefs are fun and servers are friendly.  Good food and great price.  Try it.

photos.caption: Photo of Kobe Teppan & Sushi - Tempe, AZ, United States. Teppen

00W4rVwCSv_mXpT_wDe-4A.text: Went here Tuesday night for my husband birthday. We experienced the tepan and our chef did a great job. The tepan food items are served with miso soup and steam rice. If you want to have your rice cooked in front of you you need yo order the fried one, which I didn't know. Next time :) It was fun!

Q3WxTa54fvrKUs2M5Jedbw.text: The filet meal was good, the soup was nice, the sushi was really good and the service was excellent - loved the place!

TJ8yuTeE5c4IdZlGSp3YUg.text: really bad reserve. i will never back, i came in on 7pm and i waited for 2hours . i was very hungry

QisNPSr59niDTOBes1VlLw.text: I just had the best birthday ever here. Our chef Taylor was AMAZING!!! I don't think I have ever had this great of an experience at a teppan restaurant. Not only did Taylor make the most delicious food (have to try medium rare filet mignon) but his spirits made our whole table laugh out loud literally. Will definitely be back here!!

3s_ktlP8wAJmas4vd62XGw.text: I would give 4/5 stars for the restaurant overall. Food is good, good drinks and I love the unlimited sushi deal.   But I would give one star for the waitress on the sushi bar side. She's an idiot and she is terrible at waitressing. I've had her two times now and both she has been completely incompetent and should not work in this field.   The first time my boyfriend and I went 3 tables got up and left or switched waitresses because of her. She gave us doubles of everything and was so confused as to why that happened and I heard a hostess telling her she did it wrong.   This last time she brought us the wrong beers. I told her, I don't know if they switched the taps or if she just brought the wrong beer. While we were waiting for 10-15 mins to get our drinks, she comes by and asks if we're ready to order and I told her we were both getting unlimited sushi and she says "oh yeah. Let me get your drinks and I'll be back" another 10 mins. Then she comes back and since she's so GD slow we tried ordering everything we wanted and in the middle she kept trying to walk away like she thought that was enough. We ordered one appetizer and 2 rolls and 5 sushi. Then she didn't come back to our table for a good 20 mins.. Got the food. Then she disappeared for 30 mins. But once we put the card on the table she was very attentive and wanted to act like she gave a F. I really do not like this woman. And next time we go, if we get her I will just request somebody that isn't a complete idiot.

vcHaaS6tWUhwEnIPyd6fFw.text: Went there for my husband's birthday because he wanted to try tepan.  We'll never go back.  Food was OK but not great, our server's attitude was lackluster/disinterested and the show was..meh.  I'm mostly irritated at management's lack of concern.  A bottle of gluten-free soy bottle costs $3.50 and they couldn't be bothered to have some on hand?  I got served a bowl of plain lettuce because they had no gluten-free salad dressing (with the stuff they had on hand, they could have easily whipped up a quick substitute.)    Next time, we will go to Y.C's Mongolian Grill.  Better value, they are very good about diners with food allergies and they're much friendlier.

qM5YtcK9Q1OXvIGdOASgnA.text: We have been here several times, but it has been at least a year since our last visit. We had a fantastic time!  Our chef was Taylor, and he was absolutely wonderful . He kept us entertained and provided a great show. There were two young children at the table and he was appropriate to for their ages as well.  I ordered steak and my husband had the chicken. I also ordered one sushi roll .  Overall it was a great experience. Taylor was by far the best chef/entertainer we've had at Kobe. I would definitely ask for his table again.

7ANevYhk5SIa8zPSDHFv-A.text: I have been here a few times for lunch and their foods are pretty consistent. Today I went with 7 co-workers for lunch. We ordered mostly from the lunch specials. I understand we had a large group but my food took an hour and was the last to arrive. I asked the server and she said we only had one cook in the kitchen. Really? I was not that hungry but normally lunch special is fast and honestly who has an hour to sit around and wait for food during a work lunch. If I was not with a group of people I walked out a long time ago. Ridiculous

Xes1imUQtrRoGFQwPsqP9Q.text: They have the best Japanese food in the area for sure!  The waiters are always friendly and go above and beyond every time my husband and I visit. The prices are like any other Japanese steak house but it is worth it.  If you order shrimp - pair it with the spicy mayo instead of the ginger sauce - it's my favorite!

12cGtpI2LR199m2wdX-wcQ.text: This place is so good it takes a lot to give less than 5 stars, even an employees motorcycle parts in the corner doesn't waiver my 5 stars.

fx91sinkhTZSYUMsGAIHRw.text: Filet mignon is delish! Big portions! Fun show! Didn't catch the shrimp in the mouth though :( (just a tip, chairs are not comfy if your legs go numb easily)

1HUg0BUTCs-6jPh9ZrnunA.text: This is the place if want to set up shop with your laptop like you're at IHOP. The food takes FOREVER. Plan on 1.5 hours for lunch. I've been here a few times and the service is not great and the food always takes too long. Excited for my birthday lunch today with my niece, we were the first customers to arrive at 11:30am. I ordered the chicken fried rice and my niece ordered the bento box. Two items on their lunch menu. I received my entree first and assumed my niece's entree would arrive shortly after. It arrived 15 minutes later. If you don't think 15 minutes is a long time, cook some rice and set it out and you'll learn it will be less than ideal. Not sure why they would not serve the food at the same time. I left a message with the front host to inform the manager to call me and I never received a call.  I will NEVER go back EVER. I work in the area with 2000 other employees and will be sure to inform them of my experience.

DPI_X20eKdS5p3DPBOVaWg.text: Food was great, really delicious. And some of the best sushi I have had thus far in Tempe. Atmosphere was also great.  Service was, eh. We called ahead of time to see if they can do brown rice on their sushi. They said yes. So we go in and when we order it they say, no they don't. According to them it's something with the way the brown rice is made, the texture isn't right for sushi. Well then how bout you tell that to the several restaurants I've been to that DO make sushi with brown rice. What a load of crock. Food (if you don't want brown rice) was great. But the service was lacking; kinda like they didn't have much clue to what they are doing.

RGiJdSztZ6vcxUJCxkLUYQ.text: The service was great. The decor is nice. The Shashimi was lacking. I've had better at lower tier restaurants.   I didn't have tappanyaki, so you can throw the baby out with the bath water.

photos.caption: Photo of Kobe Teppan & Sushi - Tempe, AZ, United States. Vegas roll, Shashimi combo from lunch special.

gjeZ8x--Qti0IgWz6DnRSg.text: This is  our favorite restaurant! So nice atmosphere. Delicious food that cooks in front of you! Strongly recommend this place to visit. We had great time with family today.

t1syEF26wXl6i9jRBJgRQg.text: We had a great chef - new to this restaurant.  Bailey was great and made our daughter laugh - a good birthday celebration.  This is her favorite restaurant.

8H3xcALvWlWbhPpl8zeMiQ.text: The eel sauce on the sushi was gag worthy and the service was almost as bad. At least the prices on the sake bombs were reasonable so we could drink away the disappointment.   1/10, won't be back.

XJ66Gwfm6TW1Il1sggANzg.text: My husband and I came here for dinner on Valentine's Day. The place was packed , but I'm pretty sure every where else too. Thank goodness my husband had made prior reservations earlier that week because they weren't doing any walk-ins.   To start, we ordered white fish and salmon sushimi and the Las Vegas roll. I don't like raw fish, but my husband does and he said the sushimis were good. The Las Vegas roll ... Let's just say I've had better. Don't think I'll be ordering that there anymore. For our teppanaki meal, I ordered the New York steak and chicken and my husband had the New York steak and shrimp. We were also served miso soup, salad with ginger dressing and also shrimp appetizer.   Our chef was funny and very talkative. That was a good thing because we were sitting with 8 other people who we didn't know, so he broke the ice because afterwards we all started talking, which was nice.   Our total bill was $110 not including tip, but I thought it was well worth it. I'd come back again for sure.

l9PbUoqJIwKcF2oMt9YHWA.text: Bit pricey. Wish I would have stuck with sashimi. Shrimp tempura was fried so my tummy has been upset. My fault not there's.... Now I know!!

photos.caption: Photo of Kobe Teppan & Sushi - Tempe, AZ, United States

huuInJ29U70CJx2srA0Ofg.text: This place has never let me or my girlfriend down and we've been coming for 3 years!!! Sushi or teppan, you can't go wrong.

photos.caption: Photo of Kobe Teppan & Sushi - Tempe, AZ, United States. Let there be light!

hBsip5BCmSlo_aJWLlBOBg.text: I have seen this place when I passed by going to work, and decided to give it a go. I had taken my wife here for dinner along with a few friends. I can definitely say this is a great spot for groups. You get your own personal chef and the staff is great. I've always wanted to eat at a sushi place where they cook the food in front of you. I was afraid I would eventually get bored watching the chef prepare our meal, however he kept our interest making jokes, interacting, and doing food and knife tricks. I highly recommend this restaurant. Only reason I gave it 4 stars is because you can't be seated until everyone in your group is present.

-rWPKBnc9L9vWYpTuOUgNQ.text: Was here as part of an 8-person party for the Teppan grill.  Connor, our chef, was hilarious and did all the right tricks and cooked our food to perfection.  The bill wasn't as much as I was expecting, which was nice.  Would definitely recommend Kobe and come back.

lQrbb58QxoyZMhAtX-2QCQ.text: I've been going here with my two best friends for several years now. We always sit at the sushi bar and we always love what we get. The only times I haven't enjoyed this place as much is when I sat at a table and had to deal with the regular waitstaff. So I highly recommend (if your group is small enough, or you're on your own) that you sit at the sushi bar.   My favorite roll here is called the Sunshine roll. It has a bright, light flavor that I have never found anywhere else. The salmon plus lemon is a perfect combination that makes me wonder why no other sushi restaurant has thought of it.   If you're into something spicy, try their version of the Las Vegas roll (it's my second favorite). The fresh jalapeno and dot of Sriracha takes this roll from great to f****** amazing.   Frankly, there is something to be said for a place that consistently puts out the same amazing product without ever slipping in quality. For that alone this place should be recommended.   Though fair warning: this place is not cheap. There are cheaper sushi restaurants in Tempe/Mesa/Chandler but I guarantee that none of them taste better than this place. So if you're willing to lay $10+ down per roll, come here.

2KBlElgB2olmvlMqgTV9lQ.text: A fun place to dine with friends. Our chef Allen was loads of fun, even though there seems to be a standard of stunts the chefs do, he was entertaining. While he had good skills, the diners did not, we went 0 for 6 in being able to catch foods in our mouth when tossed by the chef.  The floor sweepers probably loved us.  Food was very good and plenty of it and Allen did a great job of preparing.

DaWYl2Cdbpau1a62kLorng.text: Where do I start? So tonight is my birthday and me and some friends went to Kobe for a fun filled dinner before we began our night, well that was ruined with this experience.  The dinner started off by not getting a chef to our table for over 45 minutes! I felt my night was already ruined, but chef Taylor was a blast and made it quite enjoyable. The food was delicious and prepared exactly how I wanted it. So we then ate our food and asked our server Ana for our bill.   Here is where all hell broke loose, in the course of 30 minutes and 5 different attempts to bring us the prober bills I finally had to request a manager. A young lady came out and labeled herself as a "half server" whatever that is. Asked what was the matter. I then explained and she stated she would take care of it. Her taking care of it was a 10% discount. I felt so insulted, not only did I have to cancel my birthday plans but they felt my time and frustration was only worth 10%.   Thanks Kobe for ruining my birthday plans.

lhy2ixi4XomMiJrPhO79Ig.text: Happy hour is great. Staff is friendly. Food is good too. It's a great location. Patio has room

aVobtMnaXIKTDsFRbg4N1g.text: Really good Teppanyaki and great chefs that are quite entertaining.  Great for kids too, they seem to love the show.  The sushi is not bad either.

d0i9EkpH8UNG_1qxIiA6kQ.text: Worst experience at a restaurant in my entire life. I had a horrible experience and the management team (including the owner) smirked at me, belittled me, argued at me, and lied straight to my face. I was going to Kobe about three times a week for happy hour and after my experience tonight, for Valentines Day, I will never go back. I've never felt so insulted in my life at a restaurant.

h6wFlD4JpbKsqkBHajUQrw.text: Stars is only based on service which is ridiculously slow even when there weren't many customers. The food is still very good and high quality for beef. Portions are large and the chefs are fun. Great place to celebrate and spend at least 2-2.5 hours.

Lkqc8XImBuHFP0CfQjAPog.text: Comparing to Benehana's it is less expensive and the chefs seem more interactive and fun here.    The food is average but the place feels a little dirty to me.    I have been here a few times for a birthday and it's always fun.  It is a busy and loud restaurant, too, however I think most teppanyaki places are.   It's not my first choice but I will go if one of my friends picks it.

ZJNtAgYChbyiiumyq-gYzA.text: Went here for my daughter's 16th birthday on a Sunday afternoon, and had a great time.  The show was entertaining, and the food was (mostly) delicious.  We didn't have to share a table, because there was only one other family there at the time, and they were given their own table.   My daughter and I ordered the lemonade, and it was so good.  She had elderberry (which almost had a sweet tart taste to it),and mine was strawberry (which was a bit on the sweet side, but I like that).    My family did not enjoy the miso soup.  They found it too salty.  I ate it, but it wasn't my favorite.  Besides the miso soup, the only other thing we didn't like was that the restaurant was so dark.  This was in the middle of the day, and it felt almost dungeon-like.  My daughter and I had shrimp with japanese noodles and it was delish!  There was a good amount of plump shrimp.  My husband ordered the chicken, and had it with teriyaki sauce, which he said was outstanding.  My son had the new york strip steak with soy sauce, and he said he loved it.  The veggies were cooked the way we like, crisp tender. We also enjoyed the chicken fried rice.    I like that they give the lunch price at lunchtime on Sunday, as many places charge dinner prices all day on the weekends.  It was very reasonable.
